<!-- Layout -->

				<div id="content">
					<div class="marginator">
					
										
					<a href="#sidebar-left" id="skip-to-nav">Skip to Navigation</a>

									
						<h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Theatre: Brown/Trinity Rep Acting &amp; Directing</h1>
					<div class="columns main-columns">


						

						<div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">

							
																												
							<div class="clear-block">
								

<article id="node-1307" class="main-article node">







  <div class="content">
        
    <p>The principles governing&nbsp;<a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/" rel="nofollow">Brown/Trinity Repertory Acting and Directing programs</a>&nbsp;are based on a belief that all else proceeds from the primary image of an actor on a platform talking to an audience.</p>
<table style="border-width:0px; border-style:solid; width:225px; background-color:#ffffff" align="right">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p><strong>Watch a video about the Brown/Trinity Rep Acting &amp; Directing Program</strong></p>
<p><a href="http://vimeopro.com/user15409844/btrp-sc-2015-what-we-do-1?iframe=true&amp;width=1000&amp;height=650&amp;auto_thumb=1" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool//sites/brown.edu.academics.gradschool/files/images/trinityrepvideothumb.jpg" alt="Video Thumb" /></a></p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Actors are not the only artists in theater, nor are they the most important, but all artists in the theater (playwrights, directors, designers, and actors) start from the premise that the essence of our art is actors engaging with an audience, and that our common goal is to explore and enhance the live, communal experience that is at the heart of theater.</p>
<p>The course of study combines the best aspects of conservatory training with the practical experience of a three-year internship at a professional theater, enhanced by the academic courses and credentials supplied by a university degree program. Students graduating from the program should have the skills necessary to work as actors, directors, teachers, or a combination of all three.</p>
<p><strong>Additional resources:</strong>&nbsp;Brown's special collections: Harris Collection of American Drama, the Sidney Albert Shaw Collection, the Smith Magicana Collection, three theaters, eight studios, departmental library, Harvard Theatre Collection, easily accessible resources throughout New England and in New York City, as well as downtown Providence theater spaces.</p>
<p><strong>Completion Requirements</strong><br /><strong>M.F.A. Acting: </strong>The core curriculum consists of daily acting, voice, and movement classes, supplemented by frequent workshops in specialty areas. Technique work continues throughout the program, but there is a progressive shift in emphasis from the acquisition and refinement of skills to their practical application. In the final semester, through individual and group sessions, the student focuses strongly on showcase presentations and thesis work. In addition to classroom training, assignments in the Consortium and/or Trinity Rep Company productions will be an important component of training. Students will be expected to participate in a variety of studio and mainstage productions. Understudy duties on mainstage Trinity productions may also be assigned; the combination of understudy and performance work will give the graduating student enough candidate weeks to be awarded his or her Equity card upon graduation.</p>
<p><strong>M.F.A. Directing: </strong>The three-year program is defined thematically in the following manner: first year: story, text analysis and dramatic action&nbsp;—&nbsp;contemporary and modern drama; second year: conceptualization - verse drama and new plays; third year: collaboration and expanded forms. Directors will participate in a weekly directors' seminar, led by members of the Brown faculty and Trinity Rep artistic staff. In addition, they will attend academic courses designed to introduce a variety of theoretical concerns and methodological approaches. Directors will also participate in collaborative courses that combine students and faculty from the programs in playwriting, acting, directing, and design. In addition to classroom work, directing students will be expected to assist on two Trinity Rep main-stage productions, direct at least four studio productions, and direct a thesis project with full design support. Members of the directing faculty will closely supervise each of these productions.</p>
<p><strong>Admission Information</strong><br /><strong>Admission requirements:</strong>&nbsp;A photo, resume, and a private audition. Applicants are not required to respond to the questions regarding published articles or books and fluency in a foreign language in the Graduate School application. A writing sample is required for the Director's program (please see the <a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/programs/admission/" rel="nofollow">Brown/Trinity Rep website</a> for details).</p>
<p>All students must fill out an&nbsp;<a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/2018-audition-form-1.pdf" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">audition request form</a>.</p>
<p>Information about the audition process is available on the <a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/programs/admission/" rel="nofollow">Brown/Trinity Rep website</a>. All applicants interested in financial aid must fill out&nbsp;the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fafsa.ed.gov/" rel="nofollow">Free Application for Federal Student Aid</a>&nbsp;(FAFSA).</p>
<p><strong>GRE General:&nbsp;</strong>Not required<br /><strong>GRE Subject:&nbsp;</strong>Not required</p>
<p><strong>Financial aid:&nbsp;</strong>Full and partial tuition scholarships based on financial need, past performance, and evidence of potential success in the program. Tuition scholarship grants are awarded at the time of acceptance.</p>
<p><strong>Application deadline:&nbsp;</strong>January 4</p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">

</article>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Undergraduate Program</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-12" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>The Department offers a <a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/the-college/concentrations/taps/">concentration in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</a>. Concentrators chose a "track" to study within the concentration -Theatre Arts,&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance Studies, or&nbsp;Writing for Performance. &nbsp;Students&nbsp;can all find <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks">a home in one of the tracks</a> by working with faculty to best design their curricular choices. &nbsp;</p>
<p>Prospective students are welcome to visit our facilities and tours of our spaces can be arranged in advance by contacting the department directly. &nbsp; Additional c<a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/visit-brown/campus-tours-and-information-sessions">ampus tours and info sessions&nbsp;</a>are available to prospective students through the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/">Undergraduate Admissions Office</a>. &nbsp; You are also encouraged to read our&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate/frequently-asked-questions">FAQ</a>&nbsp;before coming to campus. &nbsp;The building and main office is open for tours/questions Monday through Friday &nbsp;8:30am -5pm when school is in session (Sept - end of May) and Monday through Friday 10am - 3pm during the summer (Memorial Day &nbsp;- end of August). &nbsp; Please be aware that there may be some dates in August when tours are not available, particularly between August 7 and 25.&nbsp;</p>
<p><span>Undergraduates at Brown make theatre, dance, and performance-based work all over campus. Performances have been written for hallways, breezeways, walkways,&nbsp;as well as in <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/facilities">our theatres</a>.&nbsp; Work has been produced without a play in mind – improvised, found, choreographed on the spot.&nbsp; Other work has been incubated and nurtured for years at a time. Well-known plays from the dramatic canon are produced alongside lesser-known newcomers or buried treasures rarely produced. &nbsp;Some work takes multitudes, other work flies solo. The point is that there is a lot going on in a very exciting atmosphere of creative and intellectual exchange where traditions and heritages of craft are as highly valued as the rough draft of innovation and experimentation.<br /></span></p>
<p><span>Classes are a key way to get to know faculty and other students well. But there are also shows to help out on as run crew. There are costumes to design and build, lights to hang, lines to memorize, muscles to stretch, voices to warm, directing projects to propose. There are producing boards to sit on and there are sets to design, productions to stage manage, dances to choreograph, plays to write, songs to write, philosophies to write, and –<em>always –</em>&nbsp;posters to hang.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 0.875em; line-height: 1.5em;">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-center" style="width:373px;"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/images/pippin-2010-0"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/pippin duo.jpg" alt="Pippin, 2010" title="Pippin, 2010"  class="image image-_original " width="365" height="505" /></a><span class="caption"><strong>Pippin, 2010</strong></span></span></p>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Engaged Scholars Program </h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-1110" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>TAPS' Engaged Scholars program seeks concentrators who are interested in studying performance theory while simultaneously working with communities outside of the university to create and investigate socially engaged performance that tackles complex social issues.</p>
<p><em>Engaged Scholars in TAPS build community, break down hierarchies and prejudgments, and tell stories about who we are and who we can become as citizens and stewards of the earth.</em></p>
<p>For more information, please contact the TAPS Advisor for Engaged Scholarship:<a href="mailto:michelle_bach-coulibaly@brown.edu"> Michelle_Bach-Coulibaly@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<hr />
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>TAPS and the Swearer Center have developed partnerships with local arts organizations such as <a href="http://www.as220.org">AS220</a>, <a href="http://www.trinityrep.com">Trinity Repertory Company</a>, <a href="http://www.everettri.org/">Everett Company</a>, <a href="http://pyac-ri.org/">Providence Youth Arts Collaborative</a>, Central Falls High School, &nbsp;<a href="https://www.facebook.com/shakespeareinthecity">Shakespeare in the City</a>&nbsp;and RKR Rawkin Rhythmix.</p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Courses counting for the Engaged Scholarship focus in TAPS</span></strong><strong>&nbsp;<br /></strong>These courses are those that "direct the student towards the compassionate application of learned skills to the discovery and sustenance of communities in and beyond Brown." - Erik Ehn&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>TAPS 0030 - Introduction to Acting and Directing (Crawford - section 1 only)</strong><br />Explores basic acting/directing concepts from a variety of perspectives including the use of the actor's imagination/impulsivity in the creation of truthful, dramatic performance; the body, as a way of knowing and communicating knowledge; and the voice, as a means of discovering and revealing emotion/thought. There is a mandatory tech requirement and some evening hours are required. Please go to the TAPS website for specifics on admission and the technical requirement (<a href="http://brown.edu/go/TAPS0030" title="http://brown.edu/go/TAPS0030">http://brown.edu/go/TAPS0030</a>). Enrollment limited to 18 first year students. Instructor permission required. No permission will be given during pre-registration.</p>
<p><strong>TAPS 1281O - Acting Outside the Box: Race, Class, Gender and Sexuality in Performance (Moore)</strong><br />Examines the relationship between social and cultural identities and their representations in dramatic literature and performance. Students will be expected to read critical essays and plays, conduct research, and prepare to act in scenes that challenge the actor to confront the specifics of character and situation beyond the Eurocentric ideal. The goal is to strengthen the actor's ability to construct truly meaningful characters by removing any reliance of "type" and/or immediate "identification" with the characters they will portray. Instructor permission required; interested students must come to the first class, fill out an application and participate in a sample class. Accepted students will be notified by the third class meeting. You must show up to every class meeting in order to keep your application active throughout the registration process. Enrollment l<span>imited to 18. DPLL</span></p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-left" style="width:168px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/Screen Shot 2014-01-27 at 3.52.16 PM.ursa-thumbnail.png" alt="" title=""  class="image image-ursa-thumbnail " width="160" height="90" /></span><strong>TAPS 1281Z - Artists and Scientists as Partners </strong>focuses on current research on and practices in arts and healing, with an emphasis on dance and music for persons with Parkinson's Disease (PD) and Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD).&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><br />TAPS 1330 - Dance History</strong>&nbsp;(in collaboration Deanna Camputaro, master teacher wit<span>h the Arts, Communication &amp; Teaching Academy (ACT) of Central Falls High School), invents new relationships between academic content, new pedagogies, and community engagement.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong>TAPS 0330: Mande Dance, Music and Culture&nbsp;and&nbsp;<br />TAPS 1390: Contemporary Mande Performance Traditions.</strong><span style="font-size: 0.875em;">These two courses examine the life-cycle celebratory dances, </span>musics<span style="font-size: 0.875em;"> and folklore of the Mande people of Mali, Burkina Faso, </span>Senegal<span style="font-size: 0.875em;"> and Guinea. Students work with Master Artists from around the globe during the co-curricular annual&nbsp;international festival THE RHYTHM OF CHANGE.</span></p>
<p class="courseblocktitle"><strong>TAPS&nbsp;16</strong><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-left" style="width:136px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/elGrito_posterfinals03.preview.jpg" alt="" title=""  class="image image-preview " width="128" height="195" /></span><strong>10 - Political Theatre of the Americas</strong> explores political theatre and performance in Latin America, the US and Canada. The primary concern will be the use of performance in indigenous rights, queer rights, and gender equity campaigns as well as general critiques of socioeconomic inequity. The course examines the strategies used by actors in theatrical performances, performance art, and political protests that use the tools of performance. Exploration is of the rich relationship between politics and performance.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"> </span></strong></p>
<hr />
<p><strong> </strong></p>
<p><strong>More information</strong></p>
<p>For general inquiries about the Engaged Scholars Program, please contact <a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:engaged-scholars@brown.edu">engaged-scholars@brown.edu</a> or go to the <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/college/special-programs/public-service/engaged-scholars-program">Engaged Scholars page</a> on the Swearer Center web site.</p>
<ul>
</ul>
<ul>
</ul>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">How to Apply</span></strong><strong>:</strong> At the time of their declaration, students declare their concentration in TAPS with an Engaged Scholar focus. Students apply to the program in the <a href="https://ask.brown.edu/home/">ASK advising system</a> while declaring their concentration.</p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">How to be an Engaged scholar in TAPS</span></strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fulfill all existing requirements of the separate tracks.</li>
<li>Work with track advisors and with the departmental ES advisor, students determine which ES-designated courses in the array of those offered (see box) match their track-work.</li>
<li>Undertake&nbsp;a practicum, a 150-250-hour experiential work with community and other non-academic stakeholders – significant in both intensity (hours per week in meaningful, challenging work) and duration (number of weeks).&nbsp;Practicums can be paid experiences or can be completed for credit or as a volunteer.&nbsp;</li>
<li>Students participate in programming and activities with other Engaged Scholars from a variety of departments and disciplines.</li>
<li>
<div>ESP students take a required 1/2 credit seminar,&nbsp;SOC 310: The Theory and Practice of Engaged Scholarship,&nbsp;that examines the theory, practice, and ethics of engaged scholarship through readings, case studies, site visits, and visits from faculty and practitioners.&nbsp; The course examines the field of engaged scholarship, highlights local community-university relationships and projects, and situates students’ studies at Brown within these contexts. Students emerge from the seminar with a critical understanding of engaged work and with practical skills to continue their community-engaged scholarship. Students also develop relationships across disciplines with other ESP students through the seminar and spend significant time researching capstone plans.&nbsp;We recommend you complete this course&nbsp;during the first semester of junior year.&nbsp;</div>
</li>
<li>Students with an ES focus gear their capstone projects to a conceptual and practical culmination of their work in this vein.</li>
</ul>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Frequently Asked Questions</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-223" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>For more comprehensive information about TAPS undergraduate program, please read our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Undergraduate Handbook</a>.</p>
<ul>
</ul>
<ul>
</ul>
<ul>
</ul>
<p><strong>Top Frequently Asked Questions:</strong></p>
<p><strong>How can I talk to someone about the program/get connected with faculty/schedule a visit?</strong> TAPS faculty and staff are always happy to make themselves available to discuss the program with prospective students. Please make contact <strong><em>well in advance of your preferred date</em></strong> with <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-advisors">one of our advisors&nbsp;</a>via email&nbsp;to discuss logistics. &nbsp;Prospective students are welcome to visit our facilities in Lyman Hall and tours of our building can be arranged by contacting the department directly.&nbsp;<span>Tours are dependent on the availability of our staff and should be arranged well in advance of your visit to campus. &nbsp;</span> &nbsp; The building and main office is open &nbsp;for tours Monday through Friday, 9am - 4pm during the academic year (Sept - end of May) and 9am - 3pm (Memorial Day &nbsp;- August). &nbsp; <a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/visit-brown/campus-tours-and-information-sessions">&nbsp;Campus tours and info sessions</a><a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/visit-brown/campus-tours-and-information-sessions">&nbsp;</a><span>are available to prospective students through the&nbsp;</span><a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/">Undergraduate Admissions Office</a><span>.&nbsp;We <strong>highly</strong>&nbsp;recommend that you participate in one or both of these programs prior to arranging a tour of our department.</span></p>
<p><strong>Do I need to audition for admission to the department? </strong>&nbsp;No. &nbsp;If you are accepted at Brown, all of our Department's activities and offerings will be open to you. &nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Can I send in audio/visual materials to supplement my application?<br /></strong>No. Auditions and portfolio reviews are neither required nor reviewed for students interested in TAPS. &nbsp;<strong>Any materials sent directly to the department will be returned unread and we will not forward materials to the Admissions Office on your behalf. </strong>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Does TAPS offer a concentration in Dance? </strong>There is no separate dance concentration, but you can focus on dance academically within the Theatre Arts,&nbsp;Performance Studies&nbsp;or Writing for Performance&nbsp;tracks. &nbsp;Please email <a href="mailto:danceatbrown@brown.edu">danceatbrown@brown.edu</a>&nbsp;if you have specific questions about on-campus dance offerings.<br /><br /><strong>Does TAPS offer a concentration in Design? &nbsp;</strong>There is not currently a separate design concentration track, but you can focus on design, tech and production academically within any of our tracks. &nbsp;You can also contact our <a href="mailto:Barbara_Reo@brown.edu">Production Director</a>&nbsp;with questions about design and production opportunities at Brown. &nbsp;The&nbsp;John Street&nbsp;Studio&nbsp;is the<a href="https://www.facebook.com/JohnStreetStudio">&nbsp;</a>focal point&nbsp;for the department's design initiative, and provides classrooms, studio space and&nbsp;support for designers at Brown and beyond. It is a&nbsp;convergence of students and professionals&nbsp;working on departmental productions, as well as artists from other departments and the local community (including&nbsp;<a href="http://designforamerica.com/studios/risd-brown/">RISD/Brown Design for America</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/Departments/Joukowsky_Institute/">Archaeology</a>, the RISD Sculpture department,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.abetterworldbydesign.com/">A Better World by Design</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://students.brown.edu/Brown_Opera_Productions/">Brown Opera Productions</a>.) &nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Can I work in the department if I'm an undergraduate student? &nbsp;<br /></strong>Yes. &nbsp;The department relies heavily on students for all its productions, including the mainstage Sock&amp;Buskin season, dance concerts, and special events throughout the year. &nbsp;This includes paid positions for undergrads with our Costume Shop, Production Manager's Office, Scene Shop, John St Design Studio, and Box Office/House Management/Publicity. &nbsp;Please check the <a href="http://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-employment/">student employment website</a>&nbsp;for current openings. &nbsp;Undergraduate students from <span style="text-decoration: underline;">all</span> concentrations are welcome to apply for those positions<strong>.&nbsp;</strong>&nbsp;Graduate students and non-Brown students are not eligible for student employment positions. &nbsp;International students on a nonimmigrant visa are strongly encouraged to consult with the <a href="http://brown.edu/Administration/OISSS/">OISSS </a>prior to seeking employment at Brown.</p>
<p><strong>What performance opportunities are available to me in TAPS?</strong> <br />There are many opportunities to perform for both concentrators and non-concentrators in TAPS. Go to our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/performances-and-events">Performances and Events</a> page to see details on our current season. We also list auditions in our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/news">News</a> section.&nbsp;</p>
<p>For more Frequently Asked Questions, see the FAQ section of our&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Undergraduate Handbook</a>. <strong><br /></strong></p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>

		<title>Theatre: Brown/Trinity Rep Acting &amp; Directing | Graduate School</title>
		
		<!--[if IE]>
      <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="/academics/gradschool/sites/all/themes/ursa-minor/s/ie.css" media="all" />

  <body class="sidebars">

		<ul class="access">
			<li><a href="#body-content" accesskey="s" tabindex="1">Skip navigation</a></li>
		</ul>
		<div class="wrapper">
		
			<header id="header-region">
				<section id="audience-gateways">
					<div class="marginator">
						<h6>Information For:</h6> 
						<ul> 
							<li id="gateway-current-students" class="first"><a href="/gateway/current-students">Current Students</a></li> 
							<li id="gateway-faculty"><a href="/gateway/faculty">Faculty</a></li> 
							<li id="gateway-staff"><a href="/gateway/staff">Staff</a></li> 
							<li id="gateway-families"><a href="/gateway/families">Families</a></li> 
							<li id="gateway-alumni"><a href="/gateway/alumni">Alumni</a></li> 
							<li id="gateway-friends-and-neighbors" class="last"><a href="/gateway/friends-and-neighbors">Friends &amp; Neighbors</a></li> 
						</ul> 
					</div>
				</section>
				
				<div id="brown-masthead">
				
					<div id="brown-brand">
					
																								
						<div class="marginator">

			<section id="banner" class="sub-banner">
				<div class="banner-text">
					<h1><a href="/academics/gradschool/" title="Graduate School" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title">Graduate School</span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>				</div>
			</section>
			
				
		
		
		
		

<!-- Layout -->

				<div id="content">
					<div class="marginator">
					
										
					<a href="#sidebar-left" id="skip-to-nav">Skip to Navigation</a>

									
						<h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Theatre: Brown/Trinity Rep Acting &amp; Directing</h1>
					<div class="columns main-columns">


						

						<div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">

							
																												
							<div class="clear-block">
								

<article id="node-1307" class="main-article node">







  <div class="content">
        
    <p>The principles governing&nbsp;<a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/" rel="nofollow">Brown/Trinity Repertory Acting and Directing programs</a>&nbsp;are based on a belief that all else proceeds from the primary image of an actor on a platform talking to an audience.</p>
<table style="border-width:0px; border-style:solid; width:225px; background-color:#ffffff" align="right">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p><strong>Watch a video about the Brown/Trinity Rep Acting &amp; Directing Program</strong></p>
<p><a href="http://vimeopro.com/user15409844/btrp-sc-2015-what-we-do-1?iframe=true&amp;width=1000&amp;height=650&amp;auto_thumb=1" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool//sites/brown.edu.academics.gradschool/files/images/trinityrepvideothumb.jpg" alt="Video Thumb" /></a></p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Actors are not the only artists in theater, nor are they the most important, but all artists in the theater (playwrights, directors, designers, and actors) start from the premise that the essence of our art is actors engaging with an audience, and that our common goal is to explore and enhance the live, communal experience that is at the heart of theater.</p>
<p>The course of study combines the best aspects of conservatory training with the practical experience of a three-year internship at a professional theater, enhanced by the academic courses and credentials supplied by a university degree program. Students graduating from the program should have the skills necessary to work as actors, directors, teachers, or a combination of all three.</p>
<p><strong>Additional resources:</strong>&nbsp;Brown's special collections: Harris Collection of American Drama, the Sidney Albert Shaw Collection, the Smith Magicana Collection, three theaters, eight studios, departmental library, Harvard Theatre Collection, easily accessible resources throughout New England and in New York City, as well as downtown Providence theater spaces.</p>
<p><strong>Completion Requirements</strong><br /><strong>M.F.A. Acting: </strong>The core curriculum consists of daily acting, voice, and movement classes, supplemented by frequent workshops in specialty areas. Technique work continues throughout the program, but there is a progressive shift in emphasis from the acquisition and refinement of skills to their practical application. In the final semester, through individual and group sessions, the student focuses strongly on showcase presentations and thesis work. In addition to classroom training, assignments in the Consortium and/or Trinity Rep Company productions will be an important component of training. Students will be expected to participate in a variety of studio and mainstage productions. Understudy duties on mainstage Trinity productions may also be assigned; the combination of understudy and performance work will give the graduating student enough candidate weeks to be awarded his or her Equity card upon graduation.</p>
<p><strong>M.F.A. Directing: </strong>The three-year program is defined thematically in the following manner: first year: story, text analysis and dramatic action&nbsp;—&nbsp;contemporary and modern drama; second year: conceptualization - verse drama and new plays; third year: collaboration and expanded forms. Directors will participate in a weekly directors' seminar, led by members of the Brown faculty and Trinity Rep artistic staff. In addition, they will attend academic courses designed to introduce a variety of theoretical concerns and methodological approaches. Directors will also participate in collaborative courses that combine students and faculty from the programs in playwriting, acting, directing, and design. In addition to classroom work, directing students will be expected to assist on two Trinity Rep main-stage productions, direct at least four studio productions, and direct a thesis project with full design support. Members of the directing faculty will closely supervise each of these productions.</p>
<p><strong>Admission Information</strong><br /><strong>Admission requirements:</strong>&nbsp;A photo, resume, and a private audition. Applicants are not required to respond to the questions regarding published articles or books and fluency in a foreign language in the Graduate School application. A writing sample is required for the Director's program (please see the <a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/programs/admission/" rel="nofollow">Brown/Trinity Rep website</a> for details).</p>
<p>All students must fill out an&nbsp;<a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/2018-audition-form-1.pdf" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">audition request form</a>.</p>
<p>Information about the audition process is available on the <a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/programs/admission/" rel="nofollow">Brown/Trinity Rep website</a>. All applicants interested in financial aid must fill out&nbsp;the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fafsa.ed.gov/" rel="nofollow">Free Application for Federal Student Aid</a>&nbsp;(FAFSA).</p>
<p><strong>GRE General:&nbsp;</strong>Not required<br /><strong>GRE Subject:&nbsp;</strong>Not required</p>
<p><strong>Financial aid:&nbsp;</strong>Full and partial tuition scholarships based on financial need, past performance, and evidence of potential success in the program. Tuition scholarship grants are awarded at the time of acceptance.</p>
<p><strong>Application deadline:&nbsp;</strong>January 4</p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Courses</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-4" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>Here are the <strong><a href="https://cab.brown.edu/">course offerings</a></strong> for the Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies for the current semester.</p>
<p><span>The&nbsp;</span><a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/theatreartsandperformancestudies/#courseinventory">University Bulletin&nbsp;</a><span>(which lists all of our courses) can be found</span><a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/">&nbsp;</a><a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/theatreartsandperformancestudies/#courseinventory">here</a><span>.</span></p>
<p><span><span>If you are seeking information and access to applications for specific courses (i.e. TAPS 0030 AKA&nbsp;</span><strong>'TA3</strong><span>' or&nbsp;</span><strong>0220&nbsp;</strong><span>AKA 'TA22')</span><span>&nbsp;please visit the&nbsp;</span><strong><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-program/required-course-information">Additional Course Info page</a>.</strong><br /></span></p>
<p>A sample of our&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/new-course-offerings">new course offerings</a><span>&nbsp;for this year can be found&nbsp;</span><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/new-course-offerings">here</a><span>.</span></p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

			<div class="post-office-box">Box 1897</div>

		<span class="locality">Providence</span>, <abbr class="region" title="Rhode Island">RI</abbr> <span class="postal-code">02912</span>
	</div>
	<div class="tel"><span class="type">Phone</span> <span class="value">401.863.3283</span></div>
	<div class="tel"><span class="type">Fax</span> <span class="value">401.863.7529</span></div>
	<div><a class="email" href="mailto:taps@brown.edu">taps@brown.edu</a></div>
</div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
			
				
	</div>

              </div>
      <!-- end .columns -->

    <div id="brown-masthead">
      <div id="brown-brand">
        <div class="marginator">
          <h1><a href="http://www.brown.edu" accesskey="1" title="Brown University Homepage"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/all/themes/pawtucket/img/brown-logo.png" alt="Brown University Seal" /><span>Brown University</span></a></h1>
            <section id="mobile-navigation">
  <div class="marginator">
  <nav id="mobile-nav" class="mmenu">     
		
        <div class="item-list">		
                             	<h3 class="current-site"><a href="">Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</a></h3>
            
      
        <div class="list">
        
	
	<div class="site-navigation clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h2>Site Navigation</h2>

        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">New Course Offerings</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-377" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h3>Fall 2016</h3>
<p>TAPS 2200R CRN 17378</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-center" style="width:402px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/Critical Ethnography_red.jpg" alt="TAPS 2200R" title="TAPS 2200R"  class="image image-_original " width="394" height="510" /><span class="caption"><strong>TAPS 2200R</strong></span></span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>TAPS 1415 CRN 17518</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-center" style="width:518px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/13 Positions_red.jpg" alt="TAPS 1415" title="TAPS 1415"  class="image image-_original " width="510" height="394" /><span class="caption"><strong>TAPS 1415</strong></span></span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>TAPS 1425 CRN 17467</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-center" style="width:402px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/Queer Performance_red.jpg" alt="TAPS 1425" title="TAPS 1425"  class="image image-_original " width="394" height="510" /><span class="caption"><strong>TAPS 1425</strong></span></span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>TAPS 1485 CRN 17295</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-center" style="width:518px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/The Activists Body_red.jpg" alt="TAPS 1485" title="TAPS 1485"  class="image image-_original " width="510" height="394" /><span class="caption"><strong>TAPS 1485</strong></span></span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>updated 9.1.17</p>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	<h5>Partnerships</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-creativeartscouncil"><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/creative-arts-council/" title="">Creative Arts Council</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-ritesampreasontheatre"><a href="http://brown.edu/Departments/Africana_Studies/rites_reason/" title="">Rites &amp; Reason Theatre</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-sockampbuskin"><a href="https://www.sockandbuskin.org" title="S&amp;B is Brown University&#039;s student/faculty board that selects and produces the Theatre Arts and Performance Studies Department&#039;s season of theatre.">Sock &amp; Buskin</a></li>
<li class="leaf last menu-tapslibraryguide"><a href="http://libguides.brown.edu/TAPS" title="Theatre resources from the Brown University Library, including theatre and dance in video, play scripts, articles and research databases, audio resources and digital archival material.">TAPS Library Guide</a></li>
</ul></div>
			
				
	</div>

</div>
    <div id="brown-footer" class="clear-block block block-block ">

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Graduate</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-13" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Brown University’s Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies is home to three Graduate Programs: a <a title="PHD" href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/graduate/doctoral-program">Doctoral Program in Theatre and Performance Studies</a>,&nbsp;a <a title="MFA" href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/graduate/mfa-programs-0">Masters of Fine Arts in Playwriting</a>, and&nbsp;the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/programs/theatre-browntrinity-rep-acting-directing">Brown/Trinity MFA in Acting and Directing</a>, housed at Trinity Repertory Company in downtown Providence.</p>
<p>The Brown MFA program in Playwriting will not be accepting student applications this fall for admission in the 2018-2019 academic year. Applications for the 2019-2020 academic year will open on September 1, 2018</p>
<p>The&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-information">application</a> deadline for the Doctoral Program is <strong>December 15</strong>. &nbsp;</p>
<p>The application deadline for the &nbsp;<a href="http://www.browntrinity.com">Brown/Trinity MFA in Acting and Directing</a>&nbsp;is <strong>January 4.</strong></p>
<p><strong>For questions about the application process</strong>&nbsp;(including GRE/TOEFL submission, LORs, transcripts, &nbsp;and other technical questions)<strong>, please contact the Graduate School directly at</strong>&nbsp;<a href="mailto:Admission_Graduate@brown.edu">Admission_Graduate@brown.edu</a>. &nbsp;<span>Applications to the Ph.D. and MFA programs are submitted to, and managed through, the Graduate School. &nbsp;</span><strong>Please do not email the department with technical questions or requests to troubleshoot your online application submission.</strong> &nbsp; You can find detailed instructions about the application process and components <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-information/application-components-process">here</a>. &nbsp;The application FAQ can be found <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-faqs">here</a>. &nbsp; &nbsp;<br /><br /><strong>Transcripts and letters of recommendation should be uploaded directly in the system. &nbsp;If that is not possible, send them directly to the Graduate School mailing address.&nbsp;</strong>Sending application materials directly to TAPS will delay the processing of your application.</p>
<p>The program is unique in its equal commitment to creative practice and theory. MFA and PhD students collaborate on performance projects formally and informally throughout their graduate careers, on projects such as <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/writing-live">Writing is Live</a>. MFA playwrights and directors attend courses on the Brown campus and join in critical theoretical discussions about theatre and performance on a regular basis.</p>
<p>The <strong>PhD Program in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies </strong>stresses research and scholarship in theatre history, theory and criticism, and performance studies. Faculty members encourage rigorous and creative thought that engage performance modes and methodologies from the humanities and social sciences. Faculty and graduate student research includes work on theatre, performance in everyday life, festival, film, dance, new media and animation. As a top-ranking program in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies, our doctoral students have a 100 percent placement rate in postdoctoral and/or faculty positions.</p>
<p>The <strong>MFA Program in Playwriting </strong>is unique in its focus on writing in multiple genres (performance, theatre, media, installation, etc.). Deeply committed to global perspective, formal innovation and social change, Brown's program is truly unique. Many of our playwrights have gone on to win major international and national awards, prestigious residencies and global recognition.</p>
<p>Committed to creating whole artists, the <strong>MFA Program in <a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/">Acting and Directing </a></strong>offers actors and directors interdisciplinary artistic training.&nbsp; Graduates of the program continue to earn their way onto well-known stages, into avant-garde collaborations and film.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>For more information,&nbsp;<span>The Graduate School Handbook for Admitted Students can be found&nbsp;</span><a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/front/admitted-students-guide">here.</a><span>&nbsp; The TAPS departmental handbook for grad students can be found&nbsp;</span><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks">here</a><span>. &nbsp;Please note&nbsp;<strong>pertinent University web resources should be regarded as the primary references for degree requirements and options.</strong></span></p>
<ul>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">

	</div>

				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>

                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Graduate Students</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-220" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2>Ph.D. Students</h2>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="width: 50%;">
<h4>Mysia Anderson</h4>
<p><a href="mailto:mysia_anderson@brown.edu">mysia_anderson@brown.edu</a></p>
<h4><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/michelle-casta%C3%B1eda"><span>Michelle</span><span>&nbsp;Castaneda</span></a><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/michelle-liu-carriger"><br /></a></h4>
<p><a href="mailto:Michelle_Castaneda@brown.edu">Michelle_Castaneda@brown.edu</a></p>
<h4><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/doria-charlson">Doria Charlson</a></h4>
<p><a href="mailto:Doria_Charlson@brown.edu">Doria_Charlson@brown.edu<br /></a></p>
<h4>Suzahn Ebrahimian<br /><span>suzahn_ebrahimian@brown.edu</span><br /><br /><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/zohar-frank">Zohar Frank</a><br /><span style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em;">zohar_frank@brown.edu<br />&nbsp;</span></h4>
<h4><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/amy-huang">Amy Huang</a></h4>

	<div id="social-media" class="clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h5>Social Media</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-tapsfacebook"><a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/TAPS-at-Brown/100262813147" title="">TAPS Facebook </a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-tapstwitter"><a href="https://twitter.com/brown_theatre" title="">TAPS Twitter </a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-tapsflickr"><a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/browntheatre/" title="">TAPS Flickr</a></li>
<li class="leaf last menu-tapsyoutube"><a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/BrownTheatre" title="">TAPS YouTube</a></li>
</ul></div>
			
				
	</div>


	
	<div id="partnerships" class="clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h5>Partnerships</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-creativeartscouncil"><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/creative-arts-council/" title="">Creative Arts Council</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-ritesampreasontheatre"><a href="http://brown.edu/Departments/Africana_Studies/rites_reason/" title="">Rites &amp; Reason Theatre</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-sockampbuskin"><a href="https://www.sockandbuskin.org" title="S&amp;B is Brown University&#039;s student/faculty board that selects and produces the Theatre Arts and Performance Studies Department&#039;s season of theatre.">Sock &amp; Buskin</a></li>
<li class="leaf last menu-tapslibraryguide"><a href="http://libguides.brown.edu/TAPS" title="Theatre resources from the Brown University Library, including theatre and dance in video, play scripts, articles and research databases, audio resources and digital archival material.">TAPS Library Guide</a></li>
</ul></div>
			
				
	</div>

        <div class="item-list">

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">The Brown/Trinity MFA in Acting and Directing</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-235" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2>Overview</h2>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/programs/theatre-browntrinity-rep-acting-directing" target="_blank">Brown University/Trinity Rep MFA programs</a> combine in-depth classroom work and an ongoing relationship to a working professional theatre. Brown University's Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies is internationally recognized for the quality of its faculty and instruction. <a href="https://www.trinityrep.com/Online/default.asp" target="_blank">Trinity Rep</a>, with its deep tradition of resident artists, provides powerful artistic assets and creates a firm foundation of real-world experience. Together, the two organizations have produced a model of theatre training that is rigorous and technically demanding, without intellectual or creative limitations.</p>
<p>Brown/Trinity includes the <a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/alumni/" target="_blank">MFA programs in Acting and Directing</a>. Students in each of the disciplines have many opportunities to study and work with fellow students from other areas, including the MFA Playwrighting students and the PhD students in Brown's Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies. Through directly experiencing the techniques and processes involved in each discipline, students are encouraged to become true collaborators, and to break down the often artificial barriers that have traditionally separated actors, directors, and playwrights.</p>
<p>The primary focus in the acting training is in developing technically skilled, versatile actors capable of working in the variety of styles demanded by contemporary theatre. Directors are given the opportunity to develop their own vision, working in collaboration with actors, creating new work and rediscovering existing texts.</p>
<p>The MFA curriculum provides a rigorous training program taught by a resident faculty, supplemented by guest artists from the professional and academic arenas.</p>
<p>Click <a href="https://www.trinityrep.com/Online/default.asp?doWork::WScontent::loadArticle=Load&amp;BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::article_id=A5FFEE05-EFEB-44FE-8C45-5FD9122E3D19" target="_blank">here</a> for more information about the current Brown/Trinity season.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h2>Submission Requirement</h2>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>For questions about the MFA programs in Acting and Directing, contact the&nbsp;MFA Program Administrator,&nbsp;Jill Jann: <a href="mailto:jill_jann@brown.edu">jill_jann@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<p>For questions about the application process (including GRE/TOEFL submission, LORs, and other technical questions), please contact the Graduate School directly at <a href="mailto:Admission_Graduate@brown.edu">admission_graduate@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<p>Applications to the PhD and MFA programs are submitted to, and managed through, the Graduate School. <strong>Please do not email the department with technical questions or requests to troubleshoot your online application submission. </strong>You can find detailed instructions about the application process and components <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-information/application-components-process" target="_blank">here</a>. The application FAQ can be found <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-faqs" target="_blank">here</a>.</p>
<p>Transcripts and letters of recommendation and any other supplementary materials should also be sent to directly to the Graduate School mailing address.<strong> Sending application materials to directly to TAPS will delay the processing of your application.</strong></p>
<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-links"><legend>Related Links</legend><div class="field field-type-link field-field-related-links">
    <div class="field-items">

<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Doctoral Program</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-224" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2>Overview</h2>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The Theatre Arts and Performance Studies program takes a broad-spectrum approach to the study of histories, theories, and methods of theater and performance.</p>
<p>While offering a rigorous background in theater history in global perspective, we also use performance as an analytical tool, exploring the labor of mimesis in the social. A slate of courses with significant strength in performance theory, theater history, cultural studies, visual studies, and world performance allows students to determine the right mix of theater studies and performance studies for their projects. We offer opportunities to take classes throughout the University and encourage taking full advantage of diverse resources both on campus and in greater Providence.</p>
<p>The&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/graduate/browntrinity-mfa-acting-and-directing">consortium</a>&nbsp;with&nbsp;<a href="http://www.browntrinity.com/" target="_blank">Trinity Repertory Company</a>, Brown's&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/graduate/mfa-programs-0">playwriting program</a>, and cross-currents with&nbsp;<a href="http://www.risd.edu/" target="_blank">RISD</a>&nbsp;make the Brown environment alive with intersections between practice and theory. The&nbsp;<a href="http://library.brown.edu/" target="_blank">libraries</a>&nbsp;at Brown provide exceptional special collections, including the&nbsp;<a href="http://library.brown.edu/collections/harris/history.php" target="_blank">Harris Collection of American Drama and Poetry</a>; the&nbsp;Smith Collection of Conjuring, Magicana, and Popular Entertainment Forms; and the&nbsp;Albert-Bernard Shaw Collection.</p>
<p>The graduate program is highly selective, with a small cohort which gives students access to regular individual mentorship and ensures success in the graduate program.</p>
<p>The Department requires that each student gain experience in pedagogy through teaching opportunities within the Theatre Arts and Performance Studies Department itself. Specific teaching assistantships will be determined in consultation with a student’s committee.</p>
<p><span>The program offers a number of options for admission. Students with a BA may apply for either:</span></p>
<ul>
<li>The MA/PhD program: students accepted to this program do not yet have a Masters in the field and expect to acquire an MA in the process of doctoral candidacy at Brown.</li>
<li>The PhD program: students who already have an MA in Theatre and/or Performance&nbsp; Studies or a related field may apply for the PhD. Students with an MFA may also apply to&nbsp;the PhD, but may be required to complete additional coursework.</li>
</ul>
<p><span><strong>Required for application: </strong>A statement of purpose (also called a personal statement, generally 2-3 pages), an academic writing sample (10- 25 pages), and three letters of recommendation are requested with the application. </span></p>
<p><span>Also requested are complete official transcripts of all work (graduate and undergraduate) in sealed envelopes. GRE verbal reasoning scores are required and are due by the application deadline. </span></p>
<p><span>All international applicants whose native language is not English must submit an official Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong>Application deadline:&nbsp;</strong>December 15.</p>
<p>For questions about the PhD program, contact the Director of Graduate Studies, Patricia Ybarra:&nbsp;<a href="mailto:patricia_ybarra@brown.edu">patricia_ybarra@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<p>For questions about the application process (including GRE/TOEFL submission, LORs, and other technical questions), please contact the Graduate School directly at <a href="mailto:admission_graduate@brown.edu" target="_blank">a</a><a href="mailto:admission_graduate@brown.edu" target="_blank">dmission_graduate@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<p>Applications to the Ph.D. and MFA programs are submitted to, and managed through, the Graduate School.&nbsp;<strong>Please do not email the department with technical questions or requests to troubleshoot your online application submission. </strong>You can find detailed instructions about the application process and components&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-information/application-components-process">here</a>.&nbsp;The application FAQ can be found&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-faqs">here</a>.</p>
<p>Transcripts and letters of recommendation and any other supplementary materials should also be sent to directly to the Graduate School mailing address. <strong>Sending application materials directly to the Department will delay the processing of your application.</strong></p>
<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-links"><legend>Related Links</legend><div class="field field-type-link field-field-related-links">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item odd">

              <div class="field-item odd">

</fieldset>
  </div>

	</div>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Frequently Asked Questions</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-228" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>For more comprehensive information about TAPS graduate programs, please read our&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank"></a><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks">Graduate Handbook</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Top Frequently Asked Questions:</strong></p>
<p><strong>Do I have to take the GREs?&nbsp;</strong><span>Yes, GREs are required for the PhD program. &nbsp;We must receive the scores by the application deadline. &nbsp;It is not required for the MFA in Playwriting or the MFA in Acting and Directing.</span></p>
<p><strong>When applying to the graduate program, do I need to set up an interview?&nbsp;</strong>Interviews are not a necessary part of the process, although an audition is required for the Acting and Directing applicants. While we do not require interviews, we are open to meeting you if you desire a visit. We do not use interviews to determine candidacy, they are informational only. We are always open to answering questions over email as well. Contact the&nbsp;Director of Graduate Studies&nbsp;or members of the&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/people/faculty">faculty</a>&nbsp;at any time with questions.</p>
<p><strong>What kinds of financial support are available?&nbsp;</strong>Please consult the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/about/administration/financial-aid/graduate-overview-facts-tips-and-tools">financial aid website</a>&nbsp;for more information.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Are foreign students eligible for financial aid?&nbsp;</strong>Yes.</p>
<p><strong>What is a Statement of Purpose? How long should it be?&nbsp;</strong>Your Statement of Purpose should be a succinct document, generally two to three pages in length, in which you tell us why you want to pursue a doctoral degree. &nbsp;And, if you have a reason, why Brown?</p>
<p><strong>Is a writing sample required? How long should it be? </strong>We are interested in seeing a sample of what you consider to be your best scholarly writing. &nbsp;The sample can either be a research paper, or a theoretical essay, literary analysis or analysis of theatrical or art. We do not place any official constraints on the writing sample, but we recommend sending a sample between 10 and 25 pages.</p>
<p><strong>Can I send samples of playwriting or other non-scholarly writing in addition to a scholarly sample?&nbsp;</strong>You are free to send us any kind of sample you wish, we must stress that we will not be able to read material that exceeds a manageable number of pages.</p>
<p><strong>What teaching opportunities are available to graduate students?&nbsp;</strong>A graduate student who is awarded a fellowship upon entry can expect to have either teaching assistantships, proctorships, or research assistantships as part of the financial award package. For doctoral students, your first year is a fellowship year. After that year, you can expect an assistantship in some capacity for three years. &nbsp;Graduate students teach in years two, three, and four, including as TAs for professors. The fifth year is another fellowship year, with no assistantship requirements. We currently have students teaching as part of the Speech and Dance programs in the Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies. &nbsp;The&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/Administration/Sheridan_Center/">Sheridan Center</a>&nbsp;at Brown also offers a certificate in teaching preparedness for graduate students. This certificate, awarded after a series of workshops and instructional sessions, is an invaluable asset on the job market. For more information, see the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/Administration/Sheridan_Center/">Sheridan Center's website</a>.</p>
<p><strong>What kinds of careers do persons with graduate degrees from Brown pursue?&nbsp;</strong>There is 100% job placement for TAPS alumni with graduates and post-docs. &nbsp;Recent placements include Harvard, Colgate, &nbsp;NYU, McGill, Emerson, Colgate, Washington University, University of Cincinnati, &nbsp;Princeton, and Yale.</p>
<p><strong>How many PhD students are in residence in any given year?&nbsp;</strong>In general there are between ten and fifteen A.M./Ph.D. students in residence in any given year. We accept only two to four students a year from an applicant pool between 80 and 110 in the past six years.</p>
<p><strong>Can I transfer MA/MFA credits?&nbsp;</strong>Transfer credits will be considered on a case-by-case basis after admission.&nbsp; See the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/gradschool/">graduate school website</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks">Graduate Handbook</a>&nbsp;for more information.</p>
<p><strong>What is the best schedule for completion of the degree? Or, What are “milestones” for progress?&nbsp;</strong>See the&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks">Graduate Handbook</a>&nbsp;for more information.</p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>

	<!-- AddThis Button END -->
</div><!-- end #print-share --></div>
			
				
	</div>


	
	<div class="block-brown_social_media-0 clear-block block block-brown_social_media ">

        </div>
 		</nav>
        </div>
  </section>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">The Masters of Fine Arts in Playwriting</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-225" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2>Overview</h2>
<h2>Submission Requirements</h2>
<p>____________</p>
<h2><strong>The Brown MFA program in Playwriting will not be accepting student applications this fall for admission in the 2018-2019 academic year. We will be accepting applications in Fall 2018 for the 2019-2020 academic year. We will welcome your application then.</strong></h2>
<p><strong><br /></strong></p>
<h2><strong>Please feel free to email chair Patricia Ybarra (</strong><a href="mailto:Patricia_Ybarra@Brown.edu" target="_blank"><strong>Patricia_Ybarra@Brown.edu</strong></a><strong>) if you have any questions.</strong></h2>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Applications for 2019-2020 will open on September 1,2018. Please follow the following guidelines when applying:&nbsp;</strong></p>
<ol>
<li>Two writing samples. The first should be a complete piece of any length in dramatic form (“dramatic” understood liberally). The second may be a part of a whole, and in any medium; if writing, no more than 15 pages, if visual no more than 15 images, if sound/video, no more than 15 minutes. <strong>If you have trouble uploading a second sample, or if it cannot be uploaded, please send it to the Graduate School, clearly marked <em>Playwriting Application</em></strong>. Do not send samples directly to the department as this will delay the processing of your application.</li>
<li>Statement of purpose. What are your writing goals over the next few years, and how can Brown's program serve them?</li>
<li>Three recommendations, at least one of which speaks directly to your work as a theater artist.</li>
<li>TOEFL: required for applicants from non-English speaking countries only; see Graduate School website for details.</li>
<li>Inquiries should be addressed to Erik Ehn, Head of the MFA in Playwriting in the Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies, Box 1897, Brown University, Providence, RI 02912.</li>
<li>GRE (General/Subject): Not required.</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Application deadline</strong>: December 15, 2018</p>
<p>For questions about the MFA Playwriting program, contact the TAPS Chair and DGS, Patricia Ybarra at <a href="mailto:patricia_ybarra@brown.edu">patricia_ybarra@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<p><span style="font-size: 0.875em;">Applications to the PhD and MFA programs are submitted to, and managed through, the Graduate School. </span><strong style="font-size: 0.875em;">Please do not email the department with technical questions or requests to troubleshoot your online application submission. </strong><span style="font-size: 0.875em;">You can find detailed instructions about the application process and components </span><a style="font-size: 0.875em;" href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-information/application-components-process" target="_blank">here</a><span style="font-size: 0.875em;">. The application FAQ can be found <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/application-faqs" target="_blank">here</a>.</span></p>
<p>Transcripts and letters of recommendation and any other supplementary materials should also be sent to directly to the Graduate School mailing address.<strong> Sending application materials to directly to TAPS will delay the processing of your application.</strong></p>
<p><strong>FINANCIAL AID:&nbsp;</strong><span>The program provides a financial aid package that covers stipend, tuition, health fee, and health insurance for three years of full-time enrollment. &nbsp;Students also receive a stipend for two summers. Funding is contingent on students remaining in good standing.</span></p>
<ul>
</ul>
<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-links"><legend>Related Links</legend><div class="field field-type-link field-field-related-links">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item odd">
                    <a href="http://www.brown.edu/gradschool/apply" target="_blank">Admissions</a>        </div>
              <div class="field-item even">
                    <a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/financial-aid/" target="_blank">Financial Aid</a>        </div>
              <div class="field-item odd">
                    <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Graduate Handbook</a>        </div>
        </div>
</div>
</fieldset>
  </div>

          </li>
            </div><!-- end .date -->
        </ul>
            <div class="date">
        <h5><span class="month day-of-the-week">
          Nov        </span>
        <span class="day">
          03        </span></h5>
        <ul>
              <li class="event  odd">
            <a href="http://events.brown.edu/events/cal/CAL-00147ca3-5eb8132a-015e-b9a0299d-0000535eevents%40brown.edu/">Community Dance Series with Jessica Pearson</a>
          </li>
          </div><!-- end .date -->
        </ul><!-- close out the last date -->
<div class="more-events">
  <span><a href="http://events.brown.edu/" class="more-link">View all calendars</a></span>
</div><!-- end .more-events -->


</section> <!-- end .events-list -->
</div>
			
				
	</div>

 </div>
      <!-- end .third-column -->
          </div>
    <!-- end .marginator --> 
  </div>
  <!-- end #content -->
  
  </div>
<!-- End #wrapper -->

     	<div class="item-list">	
        <h3><a href="">Brown</a></h3>
        <div class="list">
        <ul>
		<li class="first"><a href="/about" rel="nofollow">About Brown</a></li>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Erin Manning, Concordia University gives TAPS Graduate Colloquium Talk </h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 

<article class="content news_story clear-block main-article">

<div class="p details">
    <span class="date">September 18, 2014</span>
</div>









	<div class="body">
		<p><a href="http://erinmovement.com/"><strong>Erin Manning</strong></a>,  University Research Chair in Relational Art and Philosophy in the  Faculty of Fine Arts at Concordia University (Montreal, Canada),  presents a talk in TAPS, on Monday, October 6, entitled<strong><em> Weather Patterns or How Minor Gestures Entertain the Environment. </em></strong>The talk begins at 5:30pm in Lyman Hall, room 211.<em></em> <a href="http://browntaps.org/october-2014/erin-manning-graduate-colloquium/" target="_blank">For more information.</a><em></em><strong><em><br /></em></strong></p>
	</div>

	




</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">
                      <h5>Also in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</h5>
         		
	
	<div class="site-navigation clear-block block block-menu ">
