<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">PRESS RELEASE: Family Weekend Dance Concert Showcases Eclectic Program</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 

<article class="content news_story clear-block main-article">

<div class="p details">
    <span class="date">October 23, 2014</span>
</div>






<div style="width: 500px; " class="inline-right photo-wrapper main-image">
	  <a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/news/2013/DonaldBaird.jpg" class="thickbox"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/imagecache/ursa_feature_image/images/news/2013/DonaldBaird.jpg" alt="" title="" width="500" height="333" class="imagecache imagecache-ursa_feature_image"/></a>
  				<div class="caption">
			<strong class="image-title">Cameron Donald &#039;14 (left) and Nic Baird &#039;14 (right)</strong>						<em class="credit">Credit: Flordelino Lagundino</em>		</div>
		  </div>





	<div class="body">
		<p>During Brown University’s upcoming Family Weekend, the Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies will present an eclectic mix of new and established choreography in the annual <em>Family Weekend Dance Concert</em>.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>This year’s concert features choreography by Stephanie Turner; Brown dancers in a new work by Gwi Young Bae; and Dance Extension, Brown’s resident student dance company, in works by Donald McKayle, David Parsons, and Brown alumna, Meg Weeks. Weeks will also perform her solo piece, <em>Untitled (Roof Dance), </em>with video by Brown alumnus, Jomo Fray. Vocals for McKayle’s piece will be performed live by an a cappella men’s quartet from RPM Voices of Rhode Island.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Stephanie Turner is a dance artist and educator based in Providence, RI.&nbsp;She is currently an Adjunct Lecturer at Brown University, visiting artist at Rhode Island School of Design and facilitates Contact Improv Providence.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Gwi Young Bae is a South Korean performer and choreographer who last visited Providence in 2012. She holds a Ph.D. in Dance &amp; Medicine in South Korea and her choreography has been seen all over the world. Her piece, <em>A Trip to Myself</em>, explores our ability to understand the relationship of life to our existence and to live a life worth living.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Meg Weeks, originally from New Hampshire, graduated magna cum laude with an honors BA in History from Brown University. She has performed with Shen Wei Dance Arts and the Metropolitan Opera Ballet, and currently dances with Helen Simoneau Danse.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Set against the new pieces of Turner, Bae, and Weeks, Dance Extension will perform work by Donald McKayle and David Parsons. McKayle and Parsons are legends of the dance community and access to their work is made possible by the work of the American Dance Legacy Initiative (ADLI). ADLI produces innovative materials and programs designed to engage artists, educators, and the general public with participatory viewing and dancing experiences that connect with American heritage, building a dance literate public.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Michelle Bach-Coulibaly, a faculty member in the Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies at Brown University, produces the concert. Bach-Coulibaly is a performance artist and educator who, since coming to Brown in 1987, has created over 40 original pieces of contemporary movement theatre for the concert stage that investigate socio-political canvases, cross-cultural narratives, and embodied texts.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The concert will be held in the intimate Ashamu Studio in Lyman Hall on campus at Brown University. The studio offers both traditional theatre seating, and floor cushions for an even closer (and cheaper) view of the action.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>Family Weekend Dance Concert</em> runs October 24th - 26th in Ashamu Studio, 83 Waterman Street, Providence, RI 02912. Performances at 8pm on Friday and Saturday. Sunday matinee at 2pm. Tickets are available through the Brown Theatre Box Office. Tickets: $15 ($12 seniors, $7 students). Floor cushions are availabe for $5. For ticket sales and more information: call (401) 863-2838, or visit the Box Office in the Leeds Theatre Lobby (83 Waterman St, Providence), Tuesday - Friday from 12pm - 4pm, or email <a href="mailto:boxoffice@brown.edu">boxoffice@brown.edu</a>. To book online, visit: <a href="http://www.brown.edu/tickets">brown.edu/tickets</a>.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>###</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Contact: Paul Margrave, Marketing Coordinator</p>
<p>(401) 863-2730 /&nbsp;<a href="mailto:paul_margrave@brown.edu">paul_margrave@brown.edu</a>&nbsp;/&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/tickets">brown.edu/tickets</a></p>
	</div>

	

	<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-files"><legend>Related Files</legend>
		<div class="field field-type-filefield field-field-related-files">
			<div class="field-items">
<div class="field-item odd"><div class="filefield-file"><img class="filefield-icon field-icon-application-pdf"  alt="application/pdf icon" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/all/modules/filefield/icons/application-pdf.png" /><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/Press%20Release%20-%20Family%20Weekend%20Dance%20Concert.pdf" type="application/pdf; length=151238">Press Release - Family Weekend Dance Concert.pdf</a></div></div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</fieldset>




</article>
 </div>

	</div>

  <div class="marginator">

        <div>
        <h5>Find:</h5>

        <h5>Learn More:</h5>

<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Professor Ybarra wins Graduate School Faculty Award for Advising and Mentoring</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 

<article class="content news_story clear-block main-article">

<div class="p details">
    <span class="date">May 7, 2015</span>
</div>






<div style="width: 300px; " class="inline-right photo-wrapper main-image">
	  <a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/news/2013/Ybarrapic.jpg" class="thickbox"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/imagecache/ursa_feature_image/images/news/2013/Ybarrapic.jpg" alt="" title="" width="300" height="450" class="imagecache imagecache-ursa_feature_image"/></a>
  		  </div>





	<div class="body">
		<p>Huge congratulations to Professor Patricia Ybarra who has&nbsp;<span>received the 2014-15 Graduate School Faculty Award for Advising and Mentoring.</span></p>
<p>The award is for a faculty member who has made a significant contribution as an advisor or mentor to graduate students. Any Brown faculty member who has served as graduate advisor, trainer, or dissertation chair, unofficial or official mentor is eligible for nomination.</p>
<p>Seventeen doctoral students, five of whom are outside of Theater Arts and Performance Studies, nominated her for the award, along with four alumni of TAPS.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This award, created five years ago by the Graduate Council at the suggestion of a graduate student, was bestowed by Dean Peter Weber at the University Awards Ceremony on May 4. The Graduate Council selects the recipient.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Congratulations, Professor Ybarra!</p>
<p><span><br /></span></p>
	</div>

	

	<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-links"><legend>Related Links</legend>
		<div class="field field-type-filefield field-field-related-links">
			<div class="field-items">
<div class="field-item odd"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/news/2015-05/ybarra-recognized-graduate-advising-and-mentoring" target="_blank">Ybarra Recognized for Graduate Advising and Mentoring</a></div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</fieldset>




</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-creativeartscouncil"><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/creative-arts-council/" title="">Creative Arts Council</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-ritesampreasontheatre"><a href="http://brown.edu/Departments/Africana_Studies/rites_reason/" title="">Rites &amp; Reason Theatre</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-sockampbuskin"><a href="https://www.sockandbuskin.org" title="S&amp;B is Brown University&#039;s student/faculty board that selects and produces the Theatre Arts and Performance Studies Department&#039;s season of theatre.">Sock &amp; Buskin</a></li>
<li class="leaf last menu-tapslibraryguide"><a href="http://libguides.brown.edu/TAPS" title="Theatre resources from the Brown University Library, including theatre and dance in video, play scripts, articles and research databases, audio resources and digital archival material.">TAPS Library Guide</a></li>
</ul></div>
			
				
	</div>

</div>
    <div id="brown-footer" class="clear-block block block-block ">

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Graduate Students Win Major Prizes, Awards</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 

<article class="content news_story clear-block main-article">

<div class="p details">
    <span class="date">September 30, 2015</span>
</div>






<div style="width: 510px; " class="inline-right photo-wrapper main-image">
	  <a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/news/2013/taps_logo.jpg" class="thickbox"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/imagecache/ursa_feature_image/images/news/2013/taps_logo.jpg" alt="" title="" width="510" height="510" class="imagecache imagecache-ursa_feature_image"/></a>
  		  </div>





	<div class="body">
		<p>Over the summer break, the graduate student body of the Department of Theatre Arts &amp; Performance Studies, as well as alums of the program, have shone, winning recognition in the form of honors, awards, prizes, and fellowship.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Ioana Jucan</strong>&nbsp;has been awarded a prestigious&nbsp;<a href="http://www.astr.org/general/custom.asp?page=ThomasMarshallGrad" target="_blank">Thomas Marshall Graduate Student Award</a>&nbsp;from the American Society for Theatre Research. &nbsp;Each year the American Society for Theatre Research awards three grants of $800 each in honor of the late Thomas F. Marshall, a distinguished theatre scholar and founder of ASTR, who took particular interest in the encouragement and support of promising students in the field of theatre research. The purpose of the grants is to encourage students to become active members of the Society by helping them to meet the expenses of attending the ASTR annual meeting in November.&nbsp;</p>
<p>--</p>
<p><strong>Patrick McKelvey</strong>, a PhD student in the department, has been awarded the 2015 Wise-Susman Prize of the American Studies Association (ASA) for his paper,&nbsp;<em>Disemploying Prosthetics</em>. This prize goes to the best paper to be presented by a graduate student at the annual meeting of the ASA.&nbsp;</p>
<p>--</p>
<p>Graduate Student,&nbsp;<strong>Michelle&nbsp;Castaneda,</strong>&nbsp;has been awarded a Benson Latin American Studies and Collections Research Fellowships through Center for Mexican American Studies at the University of Texas at Austin. This award will enable her to conduct research at the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.lib.utexas.edu/benson/" target="_blank">LLILAS Benson Latin American Studies and Collections</a>&nbsp;in the fields of Mexican American and Borderlands Studies.</p>
<p>--</p>
<p>The Theatre Library Association announced&nbsp;Department of Theatre Arts &amp; Performance Studies&nbsp;PhD program alum,&nbsp;<strong>Dr. Paige McGinley</strong>, a finalist for the&nbsp;2014 George Freedley Memorial Award for an exemplary work in the field of live theatre or performance. McGinley was nominated for her book,&nbsp;<em>Staging the Blues: From Tent Shows to Tourism,&nbsp;</em>published by&nbsp;Duke University Press.</p>
	</div>

	




</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">TAPS Graduate Student, Alums Named Winners in ASTR Awards 2015</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 

<article class="content news_story clear-block main-article">

<div class="p details">
    <span class="date">November 16, 2015</span>
</div>






<div style="width: 340px; " class="inline-right photo-wrapper main-image">
	  <a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/news/2013/978-0-8223-5745-2.jpg" class="thickbox"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/imagecache/ursa_feature_image/images/news/2013/978-0-8223-5745-2.jpg" alt="" title="" width="340" height="510" class="imagecache imagecache-ursa_feature_image"/></a>
  		  </div>





	<div class="body">
		<p>Two TAPS alums, and one current graduate student, have been named among the winners of this year's American Society for Theatre Research (ASTR) awards. ASTR sponsors or coordinates several awards, grants, fellowships, and prizes to support and recognize outstanding scholarship in theatre and performance studies.</p>
<p><strong>Paige McGinley '08 PhD</strong> was named as the winner of the Erroll Hill Award for <em>Staging the Blues: From Tent Shows to Tourism</em>, Duke University (2014). The Errol Hill Award is given in recognition of outstanding scholarship in African American theater, drama, and/or performance studies, as demonstrated in the form of a published book-length project (monograph or essay collection) or scholarly article.</p>
<p>McGinley also received Honorable Mention for the Barnard Hewitt Award for the same title. The Barnard Hewitt Award for Outstanding Research in Theatre History is awarded each year to the best book in "theatre history or cognate disciplines" published during the previous calendar year.</p>
<p><strong>Pannill Camp '09 PhD</strong> received Honorable Mention for the Cambridge University Press Prize for <em>Arts of the Brotherhood: French Masonic Ritual ad Sentimental Dramaturgy in Eighteenth-Century France.</em> The Cambridge University Press Prize is a newly constituted award funded by Cambridge University Press and administered by the American Society for Theatre Research. The prize is given for an ASTR conference plenary paper written by a first-time plenary presenter.</p>
<p><br /><strong>Ioana Jucan </strong>was awarded a Thomas Marshall Graduate Student Award. Each year ASTR awards three grants in honor of the late Thomas F. Marshall, a distinguished theatre scholar and founder of ASTR, who took particular interest in the encouragement and support of promising students in the field of theatre research. The purpose of the grants is to encourage students to become active members of the Society by helping them to meet the expenses of attending the ASTR annual meeting in November. ASTR conference registration fees will be waived for grant winners.</p>
<p>See the full list of award winners <a href="http://www.astr.org/?page=AwardWinnerArchive" target="_blank">here</a>.<span>&nbsp;</span></p>
	</div>

	




</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

	<div id="calendar" class="clear-block block block-calwidget ">
	
	<h2>Calendar</h2>	
		<div class="content"><section class="events-list">
      <div class="date">
        <h5><span class="month day-of-the-week">
          Oct        </span>

        <ul>
              <li class="event  even">
            <a href="http://events.brown.edu/events/cal/CAL-00147ca3-5e6ffa22-015e-71533062-00000099events%40brown.edu/20171008T000000Z">Dreamlandia</a>

              <li class="event  odd">

          <h1><a href="http://www.brown.edu" accesskey="1" title="Brown University Homepage"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/all/themes/pawtucket/img/brown-logo.png" alt="Brown University Seal" /><span>Brown University</span></a></h1>
            <section id="mobile-navigation">
  <div class="marginator">
  <nav id="mobile-nav" class="mmenu">     
		
        <div class="item-list">		
                             	<h3 class="current-site"><a href="">Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</a></h3>
            
      
        <div class="list">
        
	
	<div class="site-navigation clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h2>Site Navigation</h2>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-home"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/welcome-theatre-arts-performance-studies" title="Home">Home</a></li>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Doria Charlson GS Accepted to Brown University&#039;s Open Graduate Education Program</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 

<article class="content news_story clear-block main-article">

<div class="p details">
    <span class="date">March 24, 2016</span>
</div>






<div style="width: 144px; " class="inline-right photo-wrapper main-image">
	  <a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/news/2013/charlson.jpg" class="thickbox"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/imagecache/ursa_feature_image/images/news/2013/charlson.jpg" alt="" title="" width="144" height="143" class="imagecache imagecache-ursa_feature_image"/></a>
  		  </div>





	<div class="body">
		<p>Announced by the Graduate School earlier this week, TAPS graduate student&nbsp;Doria Charlson has been accepted to the fifth cohort of Brown University's Open Graduate Education Program.&nbsp;<span>Through this Graduate School program, doctoral students gain the flexibility and resources to pursue a master's degree in a secondary field while they earn their doctorates at Brown University. Doria will enter the master's program in History.</span></p>
<p>While studying at Stanford and applying to graduate schools, Charlson noticed the Open Graduate Education program and found it "very appealing." Now a second-year doctoral student at Brown, she sees it as a way to gain a stronger historical foundation for her research on performance historiography and understanding of North African and French colonial history.</p>
<p>Charlson says:</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">"The program will allow me to branch out and have a larger community of colleagues and broader conversations. The credentialing will be helpful, it will allow me to think more broadly about jobs I'm qualified for, and having some legibility as an expert will make me more relatable to more faculty.</p>
<p>For more information, visit the Graduate School <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/news/2016-03/phd-students-embark-open-graduate-journeys" target="_blank">website</a>.</p>
	</div>

	

	<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-links"><legend>Related Links</legend>
		<div class="field field-type-filefield field-field-related-links">
			<div class="field-items">
<div class="field-item odd"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/gradschool/news/2016-03/phd-students-embark-open-graduate-journeys" target="_blank">READ MORE</a></div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</fieldset>




</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Undergraduate Program</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-12" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>The Department offers a <a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/the-college/concentrations/taps/">concentration in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</a>. Concentrators chose a "track" to study within the concentration -Theatre Arts,&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance Studies, or&nbsp;Writing for Performance. &nbsp;Students&nbsp;can all find <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks">a home in one of the tracks</a> by working with faculty to best design their curricular choices. &nbsp;</p>
<p>Prospective students are welcome to visit our facilities and tours of our spaces can be arranged in advance by contacting the department directly. &nbsp; Additional c<a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/visit-brown/campus-tours-and-information-sessions">ampus tours and info sessions&nbsp;</a>are available to prospective students through the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/">Undergraduate Admissions Office</a>. &nbsp; You are also encouraged to read our&nbsp;<a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate/frequently-asked-questions">FAQ</a>&nbsp;before coming to campus. &nbsp;The building and main office is open for tours/questions Monday through Friday &nbsp;8:30am -5pm when school is in session (Sept - end of May) and Monday through Friday 10am - 3pm during the summer (Memorial Day &nbsp;- end of August). &nbsp; Please be aware that there may be some dates in August when tours are not available, particularly between August 7 and 25.&nbsp;</p>
<p><span>Undergraduates at Brown make theatre, dance, and performance-based work all over campus. Performances have been written for hallways, breezeways, walkways,&nbsp;as well as in <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/facilities">our theatres</a>.&nbsp; Work has been produced without a play in mind – improvised, found, choreographed on the spot.&nbsp; Other work has been incubated and nurtured for years at a time. Well-known plays from the dramatic canon are produced alongside lesser-known newcomers or buried treasures rarely produced. &nbsp;Some work takes multitudes, other work flies solo. The point is that there is a lot going on in a very exciting atmosphere of creative and intellectual exchange where traditions and heritages of craft are as highly valued as the rough draft of innovation and experimentation.<br /></span></p>
<p><span>Classes are a key way to get to know faculty and other students well. But there are also shows to help out on as run crew. There are costumes to design and build, lights to hang, lines to memorize, muscles to stretch, voices to warm, directing projects to propose. There are producing boards to sit on and there are sets to design, productions to stage manage, dances to choreograph, plays to write, songs to write, philosophies to write, and –<em>always –</em>&nbsp;posters to hang.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 0.875em; line-height: 1.5em;">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-center" style="width:373px;"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/images/pippin-2010-0"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/pippin duo.jpg" alt="Pippin, 2010" title="Pippin, 2010"  class="image image-_original " width="365" height="505" /></a><span class="caption"><strong>Pippin, 2010</strong></span></span></p>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">The Concentration</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-198" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>The Department offers a <a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/the-college/concentrations/taps/">concentration</a> in Theatre Arts and Performance  Studies. Concentrators chose one of the following "tracks" to study  within the concentration:</p>
<ul>
<li>Theatre      Arts</li>
<li>Performance      Studies</li>
<li>Writing      for Performance </li>
</ul>
<p>Each track has a requirement of ten (10) courses to fulfill the  concentration and culminates in a collective senior seminar in which  concentrators work with advisors to explore possibilities for  careers in their area of study after  graduation.</p>
<p>If your interest lies in acting and directing - consider the Theatre Arts track.</p>
<p>For the broad spectrum of&nbsp; live art, including design, production, dramaturgy and dance - consider the Performance Studies track.</p>
<p>For the writing of plays or performance-based live art - consider the Writing for Performance track.&nbsp;</p>
<p>As a student, you can be involved in the Department of Theatre Arts  and Performance Studies whether you become a concentrator or simply take  a single course. For specific information on each concentration, click  the links above. Please see our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks">Undergraduate Handbook</a> for more detailed information.</p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>

    <div id="brown-masthead">
      <div id="brown-brand">
        <div class="marginator">
          <h1><a href="http://www.brown.edu" accesskey="1" title="Brown University Homepage"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/all/themes/pawtucket/img/brown-logo.png" alt="Brown University Seal" /><span>Brown University</span></a></h1>
            <section id="mobile-navigation">
  <div class="marginator">
  <nav id="mobile-nav" class="mmenu">     
		
        <div class="item-list">		
                             	<h3 class="current-site"><a href="">Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</a></h3>
            
      
        <div class="list">
        
	
	<div class="site-navigation clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h2>Site Navigation</h2>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-home"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/welcome-theatre-arts-performance-studies" title="Home">Home</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-about"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department" title="">About</a></li>
<li class="expanded active-trail menu-undergraduate"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-program" title="Undergraduate">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu"><li class="expanded first active-trail menu-theconcentration"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-program/concentration" title="The Concentrations">The Concentration</a><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first last active-trail menu-concentrationadvisors"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-program/concentration/concentration-advisors" title="Concentration Advisors" class="active">Concentration Advisors</a></li>
</ul></li>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Concentration Advisors</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-386" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>If you have further questions and wish to meet with someone in the department to discuss the program in greater detail, please contact one of our faculty members (listed below). Please choose the most applicable advisor for the program of study you are interested in knowing more about. You are advised to make<span>&nbsp;contact&nbsp;</span><em><strong>well in advance of your preferred date</strong></em><span>&nbsp;</span><span>to discuss logistics.</span></p>
<ul>
<li>For <strong>Acting/Directing</strong> please contact&nbsp;<a href="mailto:sarah_dangelo@brown.edu">Sarah dAngelo</a></li>
<li>For <strong>Performance Studies </strong>please contact <a href="mailto:patricia_ybarra@brown.edu">Patricia Ybarra</a></li>
<li>For <strong>Writing for Performance</strong>&nbsp;please contact <a href="mailto:Elmo_Terry-Morgan@brown.edu">Elmo Terry-Morgan</a></li>
<li>For <strong>Design/Tech/Stage Management</strong> please contact <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/barbara-reo">Barbara Reo</a></li>
<li>For <strong>Dance</strong> please contact <a href="mailto:danceatbrown@brown.edu">Julie Strandberg </a>or <a href="mailto:danceatbrown@brown.edu">Michelle Bach-Coulibaly</a></li>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

          <li><a href="http://www.youtube.com/brownuniversity" title="YouTube" id="footer-youtube">YouTube</a></li>

          <li><a href="http://itunes.apple.com/institution/brown-university/id381076688#ls=1" title="iTunes U" id="footer-itunesu">iTunes U</a></li>
          <li><a href="https://plus.google.com/100931085598361161047/posts" title="Google+" id="footer-google-plus">Google+</a></li>
          <li><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/edu/school?id=19348&trk=tyah" title="LinkedIn" id="footer-linkedin">LinkedIn</a></li>
        <li><a href="https://www.snapchat.com/add/brown-u" title="brown-u on Snapchat" id="footer-snapchat">SnapChat</a></li>  
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>
</div>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Engaged Scholars Program </h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-1110" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>TAPS' Engaged Scholars program seeks concentrators who are interested in studying performance theory while simultaneously working with communities outside of the university to create and investigate socially engaged performance that tackles complex social issues.</p>
<p><em>Engaged Scholars in TAPS build community, break down hierarchies and prejudgments, and tell stories about who we are and who we can become as citizens and stewards of the earth.</em></p>
<p>For more information, please contact the TAPS Advisor for Engaged Scholarship:<a href="mailto:michelle_bach-coulibaly@brown.edu"> Michelle_Bach-Coulibaly@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<hr />
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>TAPS and the Swearer Center have developed partnerships with local arts organizations such as <a href="http://www.as220.org">AS220</a>, <a href="http://www.trinityrep.com">Trinity Repertory Company</a>, <a href="http://www.everettri.org/">Everett Company</a>, <a href="http://pyac-ri.org/">Providence Youth Arts Collaborative</a>, Central Falls High School, &nbsp;<a href="https://www.facebook.com/shakespeareinthecity">Shakespeare in the City</a>&nbsp;and RKR Rawkin Rhythmix.</p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Courses counting for the Engaged Scholarship focus in TAPS</span></strong><strong>&nbsp;<br /></strong>These courses are those that "direct the student towards the compassionate application of learned skills to the discovery and sustenance of communities in and beyond Brown." - Erik Ehn&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>TAPS 0030 - Introduction to Acting and Directing (Crawford - section 1 only)</strong><br />Explores basic acting/directing concepts from a variety of perspectives including the use of the actor's imagination/impulsivity in the creation of truthful, dramatic performance; the body, as a way of knowing and communicating knowledge; and the voice, as a means of discovering and revealing emotion/thought. There is a mandatory tech requirement and some evening hours are required. Please go to the TAPS website for specifics on admission and the technical requirement (<a href="http://brown.edu/go/TAPS0030" title="http://brown.edu/go/TAPS0030">http://brown.edu/go/TAPS0030</a>). Enrollment limited to 18 first year students. Instructor permission required. No permission will be given during pre-registration.</p>
<p><strong>TAPS 1281O - Acting Outside the Box: Race, Class, Gender and Sexuality in Performance (Moore)</strong><br />Examines the relationship between social and cultural identities and their representations in dramatic literature and performance. Students will be expected to read critical essays and plays, conduct research, and prepare to act in scenes that challenge the actor to confront the specifics of character and situation beyond the Eurocentric ideal. The goal is to strengthen the actor's ability to construct truly meaningful characters by removing any reliance of "type" and/or immediate "identification" with the characters they will portray. Instructor permission required; interested students must come to the first class, fill out an application and participate in a sample class. Accepted students will be notified by the third class meeting. You must show up to every class meeting in order to keep your application active throughout the registration process. Enrollment l<span>imited to 18. DPLL</span></p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-left" style="width:168px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/Screen Shot 2014-01-27 at 3.52.16 PM.ursa-thumbnail.png" alt="" title=""  class="image image-ursa-thumbnail " width="160" height="90" /></span><strong>TAPS 1281Z - Artists and Scientists as Partners </strong>focuses on current research on and practices in arts and healing, with an emphasis on dance and music for persons with Parkinson's Disease (PD) and Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD).&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><br />TAPS 1330 - Dance History</strong>&nbsp;(in collaboration Deanna Camputaro, master teacher wit<span>h the Arts, Communication &amp; Teaching Academy (ACT) of Central Falls High School), invents new relationships between academic content, new pedagogies, and community engagement.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong>TAPS 0330: Mande Dance, Music and Culture&nbsp;and&nbsp;<br />TAPS 1390: Contemporary Mande Performance Traditions.</strong><span style="font-size: 0.875em;">These two courses examine the life-cycle celebratory dances, </span>musics<span style="font-size: 0.875em;"> and folklore of the Mande people of Mali, Burkina Faso, </span>Senegal<span style="font-size: 0.875em;"> and Guinea. Students work with Master Artists from around the globe during the co-curricular annual&nbsp;international festival THE RHYTHM OF CHANGE.</span></p>
<p class="courseblocktitle"><strong>TAPS&nbsp;16</strong><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-left" style="width:136px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/elGrito_posterfinals03.preview.jpg" alt="" title=""  class="image image-preview " width="128" height="195" /></span><strong>10 - Political Theatre of the Americas</strong> explores political theatre and performance in Latin America, the US and Canada. The primary concern will be the use of performance in indigenous rights, queer rights, and gender equity campaigns as well as general critiques of socioeconomic inequity. The course examines the strategies used by actors in theatrical performances, performance art, and political protests that use the tools of performance. Exploration is of the rich relationship between politics and performance.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"> </span></strong></p>
<hr />
<p><strong> </strong></p>
<p><strong>More information</strong></p>
<p>For general inquiries about the Engaged Scholars Program, please contact <a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:engaged-scholars@brown.edu">engaged-scholars@brown.edu</a> or go to the <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/college/special-programs/public-service/engaged-scholars-program">Engaged Scholars page</a> on the Swearer Center web site.</p>
<ul>
</ul>
<ul>
</ul>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">How to Apply</span></strong><strong>:</strong> At the time of their declaration, students declare their concentration in TAPS with an Engaged Scholar focus. Students apply to the program in the <a href="https://ask.brown.edu/home/">ASK advising system</a> while declaring their concentration.</p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">How to be an Engaged scholar in TAPS</span></strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fulfill all existing requirements of the separate tracks.</li>
<li>Work with track advisors and with the departmental ES advisor, students determine which ES-designated courses in the array of those offered (see box) match their track-work.</li>
<li>Undertake&nbsp;a practicum, a 150-250-hour experiential work with community and other non-academic stakeholders – significant in both intensity (hours per week in meaningful, challenging work) and duration (number of weeks).&nbsp;Practicums can be paid experiences or can be completed for credit or as a volunteer.&nbsp;</li>
<li>Students participate in programming and activities with other Engaged Scholars from a variety of departments and disciplines.</li>
<li>
<div>ESP students take a required 1/2 credit seminar,&nbsp;SOC 310: The Theory and Practice of Engaged Scholarship,&nbsp;that examines the theory, practice, and ethics of engaged scholarship through readings, case studies, site visits, and visits from faculty and practitioners.&nbsp; The course examines the field of engaged scholarship, highlights local community-university relationships and projects, and situates students’ studies at Brown within these contexts. Students emerge from the seminar with a critical understanding of engaged work and with practical skills to continue their community-engaged scholarship. Students also develop relationships across disciplines with other ESP students through the seminar and spend significant time researching capstone plans.&nbsp;We recommend you complete this course&nbsp;during the first semester of junior year.&nbsp;</div>
</li>
<li>Students with an ES focus gear their capstone projects to a conceptual and practical culmination of their work in this vein.</li>
</ul>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">

	</div>

<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Additional Course Information</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-326" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p><span>Most, if not all of these classes are Instructor Override. &nbsp;If you have general questions about obtaining an&nbsp;</span><em>Instructor Override</em><span>, please consult the&nbsp;</span><a href="http://brown.edu/Administration/Registrar/FAQs/index.html" target="_blank">Student FAQ at the Office of the Registrar's website</a><span>.</span></p>
<p>See below for application forms and further instructions for the following TAPS classes:&nbsp;<br />*********************************************************&nbsp;</p>
<h2><span style="color: #2f2a20; font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 1.125em; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em;">TAPS 0220 - Persuasive Communication</span></h2>
<p>Instructor: Barbara Tannenbaum. &nbsp;Primarily for seniors. Limited to 18 per section. &nbsp;Interested students should fill out and submit the <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/TAPS%200220%20Application%20july%2017.pdf">TAPS 0220 Application form</a>&nbsp;via campus mail to Beth Moloney, Box 1897. &nbsp;Applications can also be dropped off in person in the main office (Lyman 106). Please note the date of submission will be the date the application arrives in the office (either in person or via campus mail), not the date that you may have filled out the application. <strong>&nbsp;Please note you will not&nbsp;receive a confirmation of receipt of the application due to the high volume of applications we receive.</strong> &nbsp;Questions about the waitlist should be directed to the department via email at&nbsp;taps@brown.edu.&nbsp;You must attend the first day of class, as <strong>no permission will be given during pre-registration</strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<p>*****************************************************************************</p>
<h2>TAPS 0030 - Introduction to Acting and Directing</h2>
<p>Instructors:&nbsp;Connie Crawford&nbsp;(Fall/Spring AM sections), Octavia Chavez-Richmond &nbsp;(Fall PM section), and Matthew Lytle &nbsp;(Spring PM section). This class&nbsp;<strong>for first-year students only&nbsp;</strong>explores basic acting/directing concepts from a variety of perspectives including the use of the actor's imagination/impulsivity in the creation of truthful, dramatic performance; the body, as a way of knowing and communicating knowledge; and the voice, as a means of discovering and revealing emotion/thought. &nbsp;There is a <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/Expectations%20of%20TA3%20Running%20Crews_0.pdf"><strong>mandatory tech requirement</strong>.</a> &nbsp; &nbsp; Interested students should complete the <a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/Questionnaire%20for%20TAPS0030%20Introduction%20to%20Acting%20and%20Directing%2017_18.pdf">questionnaire</a> and submit it via email at <a href="mailto:taps@brown.edu">taps@brown.edu</a> or hand it in directly to the appropriate instructor at the Orientation meeting or at the first class. &nbsp;<strong>No permission will be given during pre-registration</strong><span>. &nbsp;<span>No prior experience is necessary but all four sections of this class usually fill up quickly.&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p>A departmental orientation is held at the beginning of the Fall Semester as part of the larger campus-wide undergrad Orientation. &nbsp;Attendance at this orientation is encouraged if you wish to join this class in either semester, as applicants for the spring sections are selected starting in the Fall. &nbsp; Check your orientation brochures or the <a href="http://www.brown.edu/academics/college/orientation/">undergraduate orientation website </a>for the location.&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/Questionnaire%20for%20TAPS0030%20Introduction%20to%20Acting%20and%20Directing%2017_18.pdf">TAPS 0030 Application&nbsp;</a></p>
<p><strong>Tech Requirement</strong>:<br /><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/TA3%20Tech%20Crew%20Info-Guide.pdf">Run Crew Information&nbsp;</a><br /><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/Expectations%20of%20TA3%20Running%20Crews_0.pdf">Run Crew Expectations&nbsp;</a><br /><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/TA3%20FALL%202017%20Production%20Dates%20for%20Crew%20%281%29.pdf">Fall Production Dates&nbsp;</a>&nbsp;(subject to change)<br />Spring&nbsp;Production Dates TBA &nbsp;(subject to change)</p>
<p>*****************************************************************************</p>
<h2>&nbsp;TAPS 1175 - Acting Shakespeare</h2>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/uploads/TAPS%201175.pdf">Application</a></p>
<p>*****************************************************************************</p>
<h2>&nbsp;TAPS 1210 - Solo Performance (spring semester only)</h2>
<p dir="ltr">Solo Application TBA</p>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Admissions</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-222" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p><strong>All inquiries about admissions</strong>, including the application process and financial aid, <strong>should be directed to the <a title="Undergraduate Admissions" href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/" target="_blank">Office of Undergraduate Admissions.</a></strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>For more information, see our&nbsp;</span><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate/frequently-asked-questions">FAQ</a><span>&nbsp;page and our&nbsp;</span><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Undergraduate Handbook</a><span>.</span></p>
<p><span>Auditions and portfolio reviews are neither required nor reviewed for students interested in TAPS. &nbsp;<strong>Any materials sent directly to the department will be returned unread</strong> and we will not forward materials to the Admissions Office on your behalf<strong>. &nbsp;</strong></span></p>
<p><span><span>Prospective students are welcome to visit our facilities in Lyman Hall and tours of our building can be arranged in advance by contacting the department directly. &nbsp;Tours are dependent on the availability of our staff and should be arranged well in advance of your visit to campus. &nbsp; &nbsp;The <a href="http://brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/authx.php#building/LYMANHALL">building and main office</a> is open for prospective visits Monday through Friday, 9am - 4pm during the academic year (Sept - end of May) and 9am - 3pm (Memorial Day &nbsp;- August). &nbsp; &nbsp;Please be aware there may be dates when we are unable to accomodate&nbsp;tours, particularly between August 5 and August 28.</span></span></p>
<p><span><span><span></span>Additional c</span><a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/visit-brown/campus-tours-and-information-sessions">ampus tours and info sessions&nbsp;</a><span>are available to prospective students through the&nbsp;</span><a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/">Undergraduate Admissions Office</a><span>. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<span>We&nbsp;</span>recommend that you participate in one or both of these programs prior to arranging a tour of our department.</span></span></p>
<p><img class="slide-main-image" src="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/sites/brown.edu.admission.undergraduate/files/images/in_deo_closeup.brown_slides_main_column.jpg" border="0" alt="In Deo Speramus" width="530" height="364" /></p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">
                      <h5>Also in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</h5>
         		
	
	<div class="site-navigation clear-block block block-menu ">

<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Frequently Asked Questions</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-223" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>For more comprehensive information about TAPS undergraduate program, please read our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Undergraduate Handbook</a>.</p>
<ul>
</ul>
<ul>
</ul>
<ul>
</ul>
<p><strong>Top Frequently Asked Questions:</strong></p>
<p><strong>How can I talk to someone about the program/get connected with faculty/schedule a visit?</strong> TAPS faculty and staff are always happy to make themselves available to discuss the program with prospective students. Please make contact <strong><em>well in advance of your preferred date</em></strong> with <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-advisors">one of our advisors&nbsp;</a>via email&nbsp;to discuss logistics. &nbsp;Prospective students are welcome to visit our facilities in Lyman Hall and tours of our building can be arranged by contacting the department directly.&nbsp;<span>Tours are dependent on the availability of our staff and should be arranged well in advance of your visit to campus. &nbsp;</span> &nbsp; The building and main office is open &nbsp;for tours Monday through Friday, 9am - 4pm during the academic year (Sept - end of May) and 9am - 3pm (Memorial Day &nbsp;- August). &nbsp; <a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/visit-brown/campus-tours-and-information-sessions">&nbsp;Campus tours and info sessions</a><a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/visit-brown/campus-tours-and-information-sessions">&nbsp;</a><span>are available to prospective students through the&nbsp;</span><a href="http://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/">Undergraduate Admissions Office</a><span>.&nbsp;We <strong>highly</strong>&nbsp;recommend that you participate in one or both of these programs prior to arranging a tour of our department.</span></p>
<p><strong>Do I need to audition for admission to the department? </strong>&nbsp;No. &nbsp;If you are accepted at Brown, all of our Department's activities and offerings will be open to you. &nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Can I send in audio/visual materials to supplement my application?<br /></strong>No. Auditions and portfolio reviews are neither required nor reviewed for students interested in TAPS. &nbsp;<strong>Any materials sent directly to the department will be returned unread and we will not forward materials to the Admissions Office on your behalf. </strong>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Does TAPS offer a concentration in Dance? </strong>There is no separate dance concentration, but you can focus on dance academically within the Theatre Arts,&nbsp;Performance Studies&nbsp;or Writing for Performance&nbsp;tracks. &nbsp;Please email <a href="mailto:danceatbrown@brown.edu">danceatbrown@brown.edu</a>&nbsp;if you have specific questions about on-campus dance offerings.<br /><br /><strong>Does TAPS offer a concentration in Design? &nbsp;</strong>There is not currently a separate design concentration track, but you can focus on design, tech and production academically within any of our tracks. &nbsp;You can also contact our <a href="mailto:Barbara_Reo@brown.edu">Production Director</a>&nbsp;with questions about design and production opportunities at Brown. &nbsp;The&nbsp;John Street&nbsp;Studio&nbsp;is the<a href="https://www.facebook.com/JohnStreetStudio">&nbsp;</a>focal point&nbsp;for the department's design initiative, and provides classrooms, studio space and&nbsp;support for designers at Brown and beyond. It is a&nbsp;convergence of students and professionals&nbsp;working on departmental productions, as well as artists from other departments and the local community (including&nbsp;<a href="http://designforamerica.com/studios/risd-brown/">RISD/Brown Design for America</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/Departments/Joukowsky_Institute/">Archaeology</a>, the RISD Sculpture department,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.abetterworldbydesign.com/">A Better World by Design</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://students.brown.edu/Brown_Opera_Productions/">Brown Opera Productions</a>.) &nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Can I work in the department if I'm an undergraduate student? &nbsp;<br /></strong>Yes. &nbsp;The department relies heavily on students for all its productions, including the mainstage Sock&amp;Buskin season, dance concerts, and special events throughout the year. &nbsp;This includes paid positions for undergrads with our Costume Shop, Production Manager's Office, Scene Shop, John St Design Studio, and Box Office/House Management/Publicity. &nbsp;Please check the <a href="http://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-employment/">student employment website</a>&nbsp;for current openings. &nbsp;Undergraduate students from <span style="text-decoration: underline;">all</span> concentrations are welcome to apply for those positions<strong>.&nbsp;</strong>&nbsp;Graduate students and non-Brown students are not eligible for student employment positions. &nbsp;International students on a nonimmigrant visa are strongly encouraged to consult with the <a href="http://brown.edu/Administration/OISSS/">OISSS </a>prior to seeking employment at Brown.</p>
<p><strong>What performance opportunities are available to me in TAPS?</strong> <br />There are many opportunities to perform for both concentrators and non-concentrators in TAPS. Go to our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/performances-and-events">Performances and Events</a> page to see details on our current season. We also list auditions in our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/news">News</a> section.&nbsp;</p>
<p>For more Frequently Asked Questions, see the FAQ section of our&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Undergraduate Handbook</a>. <strong><br /></strong></p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>

	<div class="block-views-contact_information-block_1 clear-block block block-views ">
	
		
		<div class="content"><div class="view view-contact-information view-id-contact_information view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-1">
    
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
    <div class="vcard">
	<div class="adr">
		<div class="org">
		 <div class="organization-name">Brown University</div>
		</div>
			<div class="post-office-box">Box 1897</div>
<div class="street-address">83 Waterman Street</div>
		<span class="locality">Providence</span>, <abbr class="region" title="Rhode Island">RI</abbr> <span class="postal-code">02912</span>
	</div>
	<div class="tel"><span class="type">Phone</span> <span class="value">401.863.3283</span></div>
	<div class="tel"><span class="type">Fax</span> <span class="value">401.863.7529</span></div>
	<div><a class="email" href="mailto:taps@brown.edu">taps@brown.edu</a></div>
</div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
			
				
	</div>

 </div>
              </div>
      <!-- end .columns -->
      
            <div id="sidebar-right" class="sidebar third-column column"> 
	
	<div id="block-block-6" class="clear-block block block-block ">

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Acting@Brown</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-390" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>Acting opportunities within the department's <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/performances">performance season </a>and the many <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/student-performance-groups">student groups</a>, are open to all Brown students. All undergraduates can audition and be cast in our shows - casting is based on the best audition and  the  result of a director’s  or choreographer’s choice. There is no preference   granted for  affiliation with the Department, such as status as a  concentrator.  All  are welcome. If you are interested in acting and concentrating, please consider the <a title="The Concentration" href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-program/concentration">Theatre Arts concentration track</a>.</p>
<p>Audition notices are posted throughout the year in the <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/news">News section</a> of our website. Also look for audition flyers posted throughout Lyman Hall, specially on the main entrance doors (from Simmons Quad).&nbsp;</p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <ul class="menu">
          <li class="leaf first"><a href="/a-to-z" id="dhtml_menu-672">A to Z Index</a></li>
          <li class="leaf"><a href="http://careers.brown.edu" id="dhtml_menu-670">Career Opportunities</a></li>

        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>
    

	
	<div id="social-media" class="clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h5>Social Media</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-tapsfacebook"><a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/TAPS-at-Brown/100262813147" title="">TAPS Facebook </a></li>

	<div id="partnerships" class="clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h5>Partnerships</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-creativeartscouncil"><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/creative-arts-council/" title="">Creative Arts Council</a></li>

<li class="leaf last menu-tapslibraryguide"><a href="http://libguides.brown.edu/TAPS" title="Theatre resources from the Brown University Library, including theatre and dance in video, play scripts, articles and research databases, audio resources and digital archival material.">TAPS Library Guide</a></li>
</ul></div>

	<div class="tel"><span class="type">Fax</span> <span class="value">401.863.7529</span></div>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Dance@Brown</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-215" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-left" style="width:203px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/coulibaly.preview.JPG" alt="" title=""  class="image image-preview " width="195" height="160" /></span>The&nbsp;Dance&nbsp;Program is part of the Theatre Arts and Performance Studies Department and offers both concentrator and non-concentrator students many opportunities to take courses in dance technique, composition, and history. Many of our dancers come from other departments, while others come from any of our three concentration tracks within the Department. If you are interested in dance and want to concentrate in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies you can do this in any of the three <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-program/concentration">concentration tracks</a>. If you just want to dance or choreograph we have a place for you too!</p>
<p>Although we are primarily a modern dance program, we also have a strong West African dance, music, and culture component. We utilize our flexible curriculum to offer courses in pedagogy, anatomy, and body therapies and are very supportive of students who wish to work independently on any of the numerous topics that can enrich one’s knowledge and appreciation of the art of dance.</p>
<p>Performance opportunities for dancers are numerous. The department’s <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/performances">performance season</a> always includes at least two dance concerts, which consist of works by students, faculty and guest choreographers. All students are encouraged to choreograph and/or audition for these shows and there are additional opportunities for dancers to choreograph and perform. Other involvement options include working with faculty-sponsored companies and projects, such as the <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/rhythm-change-festival">Rhythm of Change</a> initiative, and applying for academic or extra-curricular grants.</p>
<p>For more detailed information or with specific questions about the dance curriculum, please email <a href="mailto:danceatbrown@brown.edu">danceatbrown@brown.edu</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>In addition to departmental course and performance opportunities, there are also many Brown-based performance companies that are open and available for student involvement:</p>
<p><strong><a href="http://students.brown.edu/Body_and_Sole/" target="_blank">Body and Sole</a>: </strong>a student-run umbrella organization  that supports the activities of all the vibrant student dance groups and  independent dancers at Brown. Please visit their page to learn more and  get involved.</p>
<p><strong><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/dance-extension">Dance Extension</a>: </strong>a modern repertory company created by the founding director of dance at Brown, <a title="Julie Adams Strandberg" href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/julie-adams-strandberg">Julie Strandberg</a>.</p>
<p><strong><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/new-worksworld-traditions">New Works/World Traditions</a></strong>: an international  performance troupe founded by <a title="Michelle Bach-Coulibaly" href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/michelle-bach-coulibaly">Michelle Bach-Coulibaly</a>, dedicated to  utilizing the power of performance to educate, deliberate and inspire  social engagement.<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"></span></strong></p>
<p><strong><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/american-dance-legacy-initiative">American Dance Legacy Institute</a>:</strong> a network of dance professionals, aimed at transforming how people think about and experience dance through collaborative programming that connects American heritage and building a dance literate public.</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-none" style="width:373px;"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/limon.jpg" alt="Dance Performance, Brown University" title="Dance Performance, Brown University"  class="image image-_original " width="365" height="247" /><span class="caption"><strong>Dance Performance, Brown University</strong></span></span></p>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">

          <li><a href="http://itunes.apple.com/institution/brown-university/id381076688#ls=1" title="iTunes U" id="footer-itunesu">iTunes U</a></li>
          <li><a href="https://plus.google.com/100931085598361161047/posts" title="Google+" id="footer-google-plus">Google+</a></li>
          <li><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/edu/school?id=19348&trk=tyah" title="LinkedIn" id="footer-linkedin">LinkedIn</a></li>
        <li><a href="https://www.snapchat.com/add/brown-u" title="brown-u on Snapchat" id="footer-snapchat">SnapChat</a></li>  
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>
</div>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Design/Tech@Brown</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-217" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>You can focus on design, tech, and production academically within any of our three&nbsp;<a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/the-college/concentrations/taps/">concentration tracks</a>. &nbsp;You can also contact our&nbsp;<a href="mailto:Barbara_Reo@brown.edu">Production Director</a>&nbsp;with questions about design and production opportunities at Brown. &nbsp;The&nbsp;<a href="https://www.facebook.com/JohnStreetStudio">John Street&nbsp;Studio</a>&nbsp;is the<a href="https://www.facebook.com/JohnStreetStudio">&nbsp;</a>focal point&nbsp;for the department's design initiative and provides classrooms, studio space, and&nbsp;support for designers at Brown and beyond. It is a&nbsp;convergence of students and professionals&nbsp;working on departmental productions, as well as artists from other departments and the local community (including&nbsp;<a href="http://designforamerica.com/studios/risd-brown/">RISD/Brown Design for America</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/Departments/Joukowsky_Institute/">Archaeology</a>, the RISD Sculpture department,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.abetterworldbydesign.com/">A Better World by Design</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://students.brown.edu/Brown_Opera_Productions/">Brown Opera Productions</a>.)</p>
<p>The department relies heavily on students for all of its productions, including the mainstage Sock &amp; Buskin Season, dance concerts, and a myriad of special performance events throughout the year. &nbsp;This includes paid positions for undergraduates with our Costume Shop, Production Manager's office, Scene Shop, Design Studio, and Publicity/Box Office/House Management. &nbsp;Please check the student employment <a href="http://brown.edu/about/administration/student-employment/">website</a>&nbsp;for current openings with our department.&nbsp;<span>&nbsp;Please note that graduate students and non-Brown students are not eligible for employment with the department.</span></p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-left" style="width:518px;"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/images/working-costume-shop"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/costumeshop2_000.jpg" alt="Working in the costume shop" title="Working in the costume shop"  class="image image-_original " width="510" height="382" /></a><span class="caption"><strong>Working in the costume shop</strong></span></span></p>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
