				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Directing@Brown</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-392" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>You don't have to be a concentrator to direct a show or a piece of live art. <span>The Department of Theatre Arts and Performance Studies not only offers a chance for a TAPS concentrator to direct a mainstage show every year, but we also offer faculty support to all of our students who seek mentorship when directing on any and all of their projects. </span></p>
<p><span>Don't forget that t</span>here are student directing opportunities all over  Brown's campus. Take a look through the list of&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/student-performance-groups">student performance groups</a>, many of whom offer a&nbsp;myriad of directing opportunities throughout the year.&nbsp;</p>
<p>A stellar opportunity for TAPS concentrators is directing for the&nbsp;Senior Slot. Every  Spring, a junior concentrator is selected to direct a funded  and  staffed production <span>in their senior year,&nbsp;</span>as part of the Sock &amp; Buskin mainstage season. If you are interested in directing and concentrating, consider the <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate/concentrations/theatre-arts">Theatre Arts concentration track</a>. For a more in-depth description of the concentration and the Senior Slot opportunity consult the&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Undergraduate Handbook</a>.</p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">
                      <h5>Also in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</h5>
         		
	
	<div class="site-navigation clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h2>Site Navigation</h2>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-home"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/welcome-theatre-arts-performance-studies" title="Home">Home</a></li>
<li class="expanded active-trail menu-about"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department" title="">About</a><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-facilities"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/facilities" title="Facilities">Facilities</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-history"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/history" title="History">History</a></li>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Playwriting@Brown</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-393" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>As with directing opportunities, you do not have to be a concentrator to be a playwright. Many a student playwright has found a home on campus within the many&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/about-department/student-performance-groups">student groups </a>producing theatre.</p>
<p>If you are interested in writing for performance (including writing for dance),&nbsp;and concentrating in Theatre Arts and Performance Studies you would be a great fit for our <a href="http://bulletin.brown.edu/the-college/concentrations/taps/">Writing for Performance concentration track</a>. The Senior Slot opportunity for concentrators provides an invaluable experience for a student playwright to see their play receive a funded and staffed production on the department mainstage. For a description of this opportunity, and the benefits involved, see the Senior Slot opportunity section in our <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/student-handbooks" target="_blank">Undergraduate Handbook</a>.&nbsp;</p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

	<div><a class="email" href="mailto:taps@brown.edu">taps@brown.edu</a></div>
</div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
			
				
	</div>

 </div>
              </div>
      <!-- end .columns -->
      
            <div id="sidebar-right" class="sidebar third-column column"> 
	
	<div id="block-block-6" class="clear-block block block-block ">
	
		
		<div class="content"><p><a class="taps-button" href="http://brown.edu/theatre"><button id="information">Performance Calendar</button></a> <br /> <a class="taps-button" href="http://brown.edu/tickets"><button id="tickets">Get Tickets</button></a></p>
</div>
			
				
	</div>

        <div class="marginator">
          <h1><a href="http://www.brown.edu" accesskey="1" title="Brown University Homepage"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/all/themes/pawtucket/img/brown-logo.png" alt="Brown University Seal" /><span>Brown University</span></a></h1>
            <section id="mobile-navigation">
  <div class="marginator">
  <nav id="mobile-nav" class="mmenu">     
		
        <div class="item-list">		
                             	<h3 class="current-site"><a href="">Theatre Arts and Performance Studies</a></h3>
            
      
        <div class="list">
        
	
	<div class="site-navigation clear-block block block-menu ">

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Speech@Brown</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-216" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>The speech program at Brown, led by <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/barbara-tannenbaum">Barbara Tannenbaum</a>, is highly regarded by other academic institutions. Students interested in the study of human communication will find  several relevant courses in the Department of Theatre Arts and  Performance Studies.</p>
<p>Many other departments and programs at Brown share an interest in  communication studies. Anthropology, Modern Culture and Media,  Linguistics, Philosophy, and English provide a variety of ways to study  language, communication theory, message production, and communication  analysis.</p>
<p>Barbara Tannenbaum has been invited to deliver guest lectures and communication development in colleges and universities around the country. Beyond academia, the reputation of the speech program at Brown continues to grow. Barbara Tannenbaum is frequently invited to deliver keynote lectures at conferences such as the Chief Judges Conference and the National Association of Women Lawyers General Counsel Institute. She has developed communications training programs for executives at many public and private sector organizations, including the International Monetary Fund and the Museum of Fine Arts Boston. Such work outside the University serves not only to enhance the reputation of the department, but also to bring current trends and practices in communications back into the classroom.</p>
<p><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/undergraduate-program/required-course-information">Request enrollment in TAPS0220 - Persuasive Communication</a></p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

    </div>
    

	
	<div id="social-media" class="clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h5>Social Media</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-tapsfacebook"><a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/TAPS-at-Brown/100262813147" title="">TAPS Facebook </a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-tapstwitter"><a href="https://twitter.com/brown_theatre" title="">TAPS Twitter </a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-tapsflickr"><a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/browntheatre/" title="">TAPS Flickr</a></li>
<li class="leaf last menu-tapsyoutube"><a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/BrownTheatre" title="">TAPS YouTube</a></li>
</ul></div>
			
				
	</div>


	
	<div id="partnerships" class="clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h5>Partnerships</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-creativeartscouncil"><a href="http://brown.edu/academics/creative-arts-council/" title="">Creative Arts Council</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-ritesampreasontheatre"><a href="http://brown.edu/Departments/Africana_Studies/rites_reason/" title="">Rites &amp; Reason Theatre</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-sockampbuskin"><a href="https://www.sockandbuskin.org" title="S&amp;B is Brown University&#039;s student/faculty board that selects and produces the Theatre Arts and Performance Studies Department&#039;s season of theatre.">Sock &amp; Buskin</a></li>
<li class="leaf last menu-tapslibraryguide"><a href="http://libguides.brown.edu/TAPS" title="Theatre resources from the Brown University Library, including theatre and dance in video, play scripts, articles and research databases, audio resources and digital archival material.">TAPS Library Guide</a></li>
</ul></div>
			
				
	</div>

</div>

				<section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner">
<a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/"><img src="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/pawtucket_simple_banner_image.jpg" /></a>
<div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/" title="" accesskey="2"><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-slogan" class="slogan banner-subtext"></div>			</div></section>
		    
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Sock &amp; Buskin</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-194" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>A unique and special thing about Brown Theatre is that students  have a great deal of responsibility in the department's production season.  The season is selected by the Sock  &amp; Buskin board, a team of students and faculty. Sock &amp; Buskin produces a numer of major productions each year and plans the schedule for the next year. Students are more numerous than faculty on the board and  so have a greater vote when the final season is decided – a situation  unmatched at any other university. Our philosophy: if the faculty are working productively with students in classes, we should respect  them enough to design a vital and invigorating season. And we do! And  they do!</p>
<p>Each year, the Sock &amp; Buskin board chooses a season&nbsp;consisting of four mainstage theatrical shows and one mainstage dance performance to be  produced during&nbsp;the following academic year. The board also chooses a fifth show, the “senior  slot.” Senior slot, determined by faculty who select from proposals  submitted by junior concentrators, is a mainstage show running for one week and is open to juniors&nbsp;who wish to direct or write a full production of their  choosing in their senior year.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You can keep up with Sock &amp; Buskin on their <a href="http://www.sockandbuskin.org/" target="_blank">website</a>,&nbsp;or by following them on&nbsp;<a href="http://twitter.com/sockandbuskin" target="_blank">Twitter</a>.</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-right" style="width:203px;"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/images/cast-gross-indecency-fall-2011"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/s_B_gross.preview.JPG" alt="Cast of Gross Indecency, 2011" title="Cast of Gross Indecency, 2011"  class="image image-preview " width="195" height="130" /></a><span class="caption"><strong>Cast of Gross Indecency, 2011</strong></span></span></p>
<p>To suggest a play for our season or to request more information send an email to&nbsp;<a href="https://mail.google.com/a/brown.edu/mail/?view=cm&amp;fs=1&amp;tf=1&amp;to=sockandbuskin@gmail.com" target="_blank">sockandbuskin@gmail.com</a>. You may also drop a script or just a note with a title in the suggestion box outside the Brown Theatre Box Office in the Leeds Theatre lobby.</p>
<h2><span style="color: #2f2a20; font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 1.125em; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em;">History</span></h2>
<p>Sock &amp; Buskin was founded in 1901 by Professor Thomas Crosby of the Brown University English Department. There has since been an unbroken record of seasons, first at the Providence Opera House and various theatres in downcity Providence, then in Rockefeller Hall, and finally in 1931 at the Faunce House Theatre, which was restored and reopened as Stuart Theatre in 1993. When the Isabelle Russek Leeds Theatre and Ashamu Dance Studio were built in 1979, they joined the Stuart Theatre and together became the Catherine Bryan Dill Center for the Performing Arts.</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-right" style="width:203px;"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/images/jared-bellot-12-dead-city-sheila-callaghan"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/MTT_0739.preview.JPG" alt="Jared Bellot in Dead City, 2011" title="Jared Bellot in Dead City, 2011"  class="image image-preview " width="195" height="130" /></a><span class="caption"><strong>Jared Bellot in Dead City, 2011</strong></span></span>In 1927, Sock &amp; Buskin, which was at the time an all-male organization, began using actresses in its productions. Soon Komians, the all-female theatrical group from Pembroke college, merged with Sock &amp; Buskin to create the co-ed group that exists today.</p>
<p>When <span>Sock &amp; Buskin</span> isn't reading plays in the Becker Library, they support production staff by running auditions, assisting construction of sets and costumes, and publicizing <span>Sock &amp; Buskin</span> events around campus. It's a great way for students to get involved in the&nbsp;department and learn about the different aspects of producing theatre. Tuesday meetings are open to the public and visitors are welcomed.</p>
<p><span class="thumbnail-wrapper inline inline-left" style="width:518px;"><a href="/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/images/pippin-2010"><img src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/theatre-arts-performance-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.theatre-arts-performance-studies/files/images/_B176828 copy.jpg" alt="Pippin, 2010" title="Pippin, 2010"  class="image image-_original " width="510" height="383" /></a><span class="caption"><strong>Pippin, 2010</strong></span></span></p>
<div class="image-clear"></div>  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
